Got so many compliments on this sweater. Wish I kept it. So warm and stylish. Only con is that if you're tall like me (I'm 5'7) it's a tad on the shorter side.

This sweater was a great addition to my everyday wardrobe. I rented it for a causal holiday party but it arrived early, so I was also able to wear it to work. My only complaint was that it definitely needed a top layered underneath, since the knit was very open in some places and it was a little short for me and my long torso. (Not really a big complaint, I just would prefer to not have to layer.) Could have worn the XS or S but went with the XS, since the sleeves were a little less wide.
Comfy!

links_reviews_title: Fun, Cozy, and Makes a Statement!
links_reviews_text: I loved this sweater. Fringe, bell sleeve, chunky cable and think turtle neck might seem like a lot going on, but the color is simple and it looks so good with jeans and boots. I found a ton of occasions to wear it. Parties, work, dinner, errands. Only complaint is I think the RTR system isn't great for knits. The sweater i received looked a little worse-for-wear with some pilling and overall "shagginess" like you might expect form a chunky sweater that's been worn several times by different renters and laundered. I think the fun details and overall impact outweighed the condition. Would still recommend!

This looked like such a cute sweater I really, really wanted it to work-- but it ultimately just didn't. It was short, yes, but that wasn't the real problem. The problem came in with the cut of the sweater on the bottom sides- it just came up too far, and because of this, my hips looked like they stuck out of the sweater. It was very unflattering for my body type.

links_reviews_title: Fun sweater for my New Mexico vacation
links_reviews_text: I really liked this sweater. It was fun and not scratchy at all. The sleeves are pretty wide.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable and got a ton of compliments
links_reviews_text: This skirt is light and airy and goes with so many tops!
Super cute skirt with 90s vibes! I wore it several times and styled it different ways. I got lots of compliments!
Fit true to size, super comfortable and faltering. Will rent again this summer!

The slit comes just above the knee which makes it so great for walking/movement. I took this on vacation to Paris, wore it all day and it was perfect. There is just enough stretch in the waistband to allow for all of the extra vacation carbs. Loved this!

I enjoyed wearing the skirt on hot summer days with sandals. I liked the slit. I tried to give a sense of how far it went up in the photo. I think it made the skirt look less flattering than it actually is. I almost gave it a five. The buttons were a little bit annoying. But once the skirt was on it was great.
Loved this skirt. Fit true to size comfortably

This skirt is really cute and comfortable. I'm 5'6" and it hit me at the ankles. The slit is in the center and isn't too high up so I could wear it to work. I wore an XS and am usually a 0 or 2 in skirts. The skirt fit comfortably and was a little loose in the waist and stomach. I was able to tuck a T-shirt in with some room to spare. If you're between sizes, I would recommend sizing down.

I usually wear size S or 2, but the XS fit perfectly. Love the high-waisted style, and the front slit is just the right amount of subtle! Material is lightweight but substantial enough to drape comfortably around the legs. Would definitely buy for regular wear if it becomes more discounted.
Flowly, comfy skirt. The buttons down the front are a nice detail but can pull apart when you sit

I'm usually a 4 in the waist, 6 in the hips. I ordered the Small which fit, but the waist settled down on the top of my hips. I find that high waisted bottoms are generally more flattering on me (especially with this length), so I sized down to the XS which is a smidge tight in the waist but because of the elastic is totally comfortable! The skirt is very cute - great for summer or winter. I've worn it with a striped tight tee and a black turtleneck and tights.
I wore this on vacation and it was so cute! It seems to fit true to size, maybe slightly big. It buttons down the front which I didn't realize until I got it but it's cute detail
This skirt is so easy to wear. You can dress it up or down and wear it with flip flops or boots. Runs true to size. I would rent again.
So cute & easy to wear! Slit up the front makes this fun & easy to wear. Daisy print is cute and Realisation-esque. Perfect for a casual weekend, will likely rent again.
Wore this to a music festival, so comfy and cute

links_reviews_title: Love it so much I have rented it twice!!
links_reviews_text: Simple floral print. Fabric is good for hot and cooler weather. At 5'7" the skirt hits 2-3 inches above the ankle for me. The slit in the front is just high enough to give me mobility but not high enough to make me feel uncomfortable. Also worthy to mention is that while it is all buttons in the front. 1. There is some elastic waist band in the back, so you don't have to unbutton all the way just to put the skirt on. 2. The spaces between the buttons are not seen through. Overall just love it.
Super comfortable and great for everyday summer. Would rent again.
It was baggy, didn't like the cut. But the waist fit.

links_reviews_title: This skirt can be dressed up or down. Great pattern fun for everyday!
links_reviews_text: Perfect fit for me. I've got wide hips but, a small waist and couldn't be happier.
Love this skirt. I wore it with a white t shirt tied in a front knot and got tons of compliments. I managed to wear it to my very casual office, a bar, and to a party with friends.
Super light, comfortable, and stylish skirt for summer. Length was great. A little stretch in the back. Could probably be paired with any color top for summer. Very cute, and was sad to send it back.
Print was awesome- got lots of compliments. Button closure, soft fabric that doesn't really wrinkle. More on the casual side but super fun

links_reviews_title: Really wish this came in XL
links_reviews_text: Good quality skirt in a flowy fabric. Unfortunately, the large didn't quite fit. I knew it would be a long shot, but the print was so fun I had to try. Ultimately, it was just a tad too tight to wear without worrying us pop a button. If you are a true 12 or on the straighter side hip-wise, the L would definitely fit.

The pattern is great - transported me right back to the 90s! The material is lightweight and the center slit comes up just to above the knee making the skirt breezy and flirty. I would say this skirt runs large; I'm a true hourglass that usually wears a 6/8 or medium. The small fit fine, if perhaps slightly tight over my hips. Because of the loop and eye style of buttons you may get some pulling where it is tight. The skirt was very high waisted. I have a long torso so this was fine. Shorter ladies with short torsos may find it too long. Also if you are self conscious about your tummy you may want to wear spanx.

I really like this dress, but it just doesn't lay the way it looks like it does in the photo. Sizing up may help, but there's no way you can get around layering. Material was thinner (less sweater-like) than I was expecting and less soft, but not scratchy or uncomfortable in any way.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable but not practical as a dress
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable but low cut and high slit. Had to wear with leggings.

links_reviews_title: The dress got so big I had to improvise to keep covered
links_reviews_text: This dress got bigger throughout the day, to the point I had to use binder clips to make sure I didn't flash my coworkers - top and bottom of the wrap. It started out fitting well in the morning, true to size ... but transformed into an ill fitting bathrobe by end of day. The fabric was soft though.
Wore as a long sweater with jeans underneath but I can see this working with stockings and over the knee boots. A loose casual fit; go with it. I think it's a unique piece of clothing...

I picked this up in store. They only had an L which worked, but my regular M would have been better no doubt. I wore it as a duster as it was more flattering and versatile that way. Excellent quality. Soft. Good for tall. Had to watch the bottom of garment on stairs/office chair wheels.
This item was a little large and the tie at the waist doesn't allow for cinching, it's a loose tie. Worn with jeans and boots. Loved the look

Beyond sexy, makes you look voluptuous! Very revealing. Loved the color and fit; however, the inner button makes the dress have a "dimple" in the front of the dress. Would be really cute as a cardigan.
Warm figure fitting dress that goes with everything
It did fit me large, since I was pregnant I thought L would be fine but it was a bit big I am 5'0 I would get a M next time or even a small for it to get all your curves

I liked the looser fit of this dress (usually a 0-2 and wore an XS), however, it was too loose in the bust so I wasn't very comfortable. Also the large slit (as reviews noted) is right in the front. I got a little creative and tied the straps around my waist and into a knot on one side. This was helpful to make the dress snug around my chest AND there was no longer a slit in the front of the dress. The length on me was perfect with a heeled boot.

I am a borderline petite size and this just about worked on me. This looked more like a maxi length duster than a dress. The sweater came down to the tops of my feet (I'm 5'4") and was a bit loose even with tying it as tightly as possible. I had planned to wear as a sweater over leggings or jeans so it was fine.

I loved this dress the instant I put it on. It's cozy and comfortable. A little bathrobe-y but the slits and tie make it super cute. I ended up pairing with snake patterned boots and a red lip. Loved it.
Lovely sweater! But soooo long! I'm 5'8" and almost tripped going up a flight of stairs. Liked it a lot otherwise but not realistic for frequent use.

links_reviews_title: It is very comfortable and received compliments.
links_reviews_text: It fits very large.
I got a small so that it would be a little more fitted and the dress ended up looking super cute ! I was then able to wear it as a long open sweater the next day :)

links_reviews_title: Very cute/comfy knit fabric, just didn't love the fit on my body.
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to love this dress for date night/drinks with friends, but it just looked like a robe on me. I think it was slightly large on the top so I felt like I needed to constantly retie it to secure it.
I wore this open with jeans and a t shirt instead of as a dress. I will definitely get again but this runs large (especially in the sleeves) and will size down to a medium next time

links_reviews_title: Great dress but more revealing than expected
links_reviews_text: This is a great length for all you talk people out there. Loved how comfortable it was. Only drawback is that it was pretty revealing so expect to show a lot of leg. In my case I wore over the knee boots and loved the combination.

links_reviews_title: Sexy, fierce EVERYONE WAS WATCHING AS I ENTERED THE ROOM JUST LIKE I WANTED THE PERFECT BDAY DRESS
links_reviews_text: Loved the ribbed fabric, comfortable and easy to travel. Definitely sexy so not for the office!

links_reviews_title: Super cute but requires some "expert" styling
links_reviews_text: This knit dress is really cute - actually, super sexy. As far as sweater dresses go, this style is one of my favorites. As a wrap dress, it gives shape that pull-over knit dresses sometimes lack. There's no lining and only one button on the inside and one tie, so with the side slits and not-complete closure in the front, this requires some saavy when it comes to styling. Overall I think it's a great dress.

links_reviews_title: Does not work as a dress
links_reviews_text: This does not work as a dress. It is very revealing. Could be later with jeans or leggings.

I got a lot of compliments over the weekend when I wore this dress (just furniture shopping, nothing fancy). I paired it with black "snakeskin" ankle boots and I felt so effortlessly chic. Like all wrap dresses, it shows A LOT of leg when you walk, but I felt like it was a little more demure because it's ankle-length. The top also isn't as revealing as a lot of wrap dresses because it has an inside button that pulls it together. It was super cute, and the perfect amount of coverage for a 60 degree day. It runs a little large in the arms & shoulder, but I don't know that it's enough to size down. But I also wore it to work and that was a mistake - it's just too revealing, especially when you're sitting. I safety-pinned the front together at about mid-thigh before a client meeting and that worked well enough. But still, I'd only wear in a casual sitting.

links_reviews_title: So comfortable but not made for a big butt
links_reviews_text: I agree with others that it's much more appropriate over jeans than just as a dress. I wore it with jeans and booties and It was so comfortable and warm. The only issue was since the design is evenly split between the "front" and "back" (by the splits in the side) and I have a larger butt than average it pulled the fabric back. I had to tie the inner hidden button tighter to keep it from going back so far because otherwise it looked unflattering .
This is a very warm sweater dress with SUPER high slits. I wore my biker shorts spanx underneath to avoid exposing myself. I loved it though.

Loved this as a long cardigan/duster. I wore it so many times layered over varying degrees of casual outfits. When I first got it, I did try it on as a dress and it might've worked but it was too much effort to tie it tight enough. If you do wear it as a dress (and you have hips and boobs), know you may need to layer a few pieces under so you aren't flashing the world as there isn't much fabric overlap below the waist.

I used this item as a long sweater over pants and shirt and it looked polished. I received compliments. I would not have been able to utilize as dress for work due to high slits. Word of caution, I would not recommend for people under 5'4. I'm 5'5 and with high heels it was still almost scraping the ground.

links_reviews_title: I wore this dress to a day party. The look was unexpected. Everyone loved it.
links_reviews_text: Fall favorite. Conservative but very sexy.

links_reviews_title: So cute but a little long for my height.
links_reviews_text: I rented this for everyday but it was too long for me. I'm a little taller than 5'3" and with flats it was too long. I worn it one time with heels and it was fine. I wore it open like a duster and loved it.

The double-slit in the front, along with the wrap waist means the dress was opening to wide to get comfortable. When you sit, the slits fall to both sides of your legs, so you have to adjust it. I think I flashed people throughout the day, which was unfortunate.
This was cute as a long cardigan, but the fabric grew throughout the day. I work 3 inch heels, and I was still tripping on it.

links_reviews_title: Didn't work as a dress, but perfect duster
links_reviews_text: The fabric was luxurious. The length was very long on me. Didn't work as a dress, but was smashingly gorgeous as a duster.

links_reviews_title: Too big and also felt exposed in it
links_reviews_text: Too big and also felt exposed in it - was not comfortable wearing out.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, easy to wear sweater dress. I wore with red chunky jewelry.
links_reviews_text: Simple, easy, straightforward dress. The wrap has a single button inside and then the tie. It stayed together all night with no problems. The sleeves were large and looser than I needed.
Wears like an oversized cardigan. If wrapped tight enough you can wear ad a dress but the slits make it very tricky when walking or if windy
I for sure should have sized down!, but other than that it was super cute for a winter casual date!

I wasn't able to make this work without something underneath, I'd say it runs a little big. Cute color, somewhat thin. High ish slits. Very cute and unique insanely comfortable. Works for casual work and weekend. I'd rent again!
Slots were fun but not sure if you wear tights or not.

The fit in the arms/sleeves was big. It was a bit overwhelming for my size since I am quite short but curvy. Even with high heal boots it was almost hitting the floor. I did not wear it for fear that the weight of it would stretch it out and Id look like I was wearing a bath robe and not a dress at work. Beautiful dress but not for short people. Need to be tall to carry this off.

links_reviews_title: This is more of a long sweater
links_reviews_text: Long slits on sides really make this more of a long cardigan. I couldn't wear it as a dress without showing way too much leg.
I've got hips and the sides with the slits weren't flattering. Great comfy dress but any bigger and the chest wouldn't work

Loved everything about this sweater. I wore a plum cami under it because it is cut low and was very cold that day. I would probably have been great in a small because I to keep adjusting it during the day, but loves the color and comfort of it.
Cute, soft slightly open weave knit. Somewhat cropped and boxy, I wore with high rise jeans and you could see some skin if I lifted my arms way up but not a major problem.
A little warm, hits just on the waist, flowy feel, v neck is appropriate for anything really. Soft.

links_reviews_title: Love the deep rich colors of this sweater.
links_reviews_text: Just a run around sweater for a cool California day.
Very flattering. Good quality. Super cute. Wore for thanksgiving.
Super cute and comfy sweater. Was perfect for a fall trip to Vermont.
I loved this sweater, wish I would have sized up as it had a short cut to it and I prefer my sweaters a little baggy. Would definitely rent or buy it in the future!
Good basic sweater

This is the perfect sweater for Fall or Winter.. can be layered with a tank or worn on it's own, it's not itchy and the fabric is soft. V-neck is not too low. I wanted to wear it every day so I bought it!

I could only wear this sweater for about thirty minutes before it started bothering my sensitive skin. Even though there was no wool I was uncomfortable and started dashing from it. But before I took it off: fits a bit cropped with a very open neck, open enough to slide off my broad shoulders a bit. It was very cute layered with a tank.

Soft and comfortable autumn sweater, but not particularly flattering. My husband volunteered that I looked like I had borrowed a larger woman's sweater. Wore it around the house for a day, but it didn't make the work cut.

links_reviews_title: Cute -- but not for tall folks
links_reviews_text: I'm 6'1" -- the sleeves were long enough and it was soft and cute--but it was way too short in the torso.
This is a beautiful sweater and the colors look great. It is a bit cropped if you are tall or long waisted but otherwise liked it.
Fit is boxy and short, but it was cute french tucked into slim-fit pants.
I have been living in this amazing cozy and warm little blue jacket. It's perfect in every way. I kin of wish it had a little hook or button but it doesn't need it. Thinking of buying this one.

This jacket is so soft and comfortable! The pictures make it appear to be black but it is actually a navy color as noted in the description (which I didn't see before ordering). But I would definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: The description says that the jacket is black, but after seeing it in person it is a midnight blue
links_reviews_text: Jacket fits very well and is very flattering. But the color is not black

links_reviews_title: Perfect addition for a winter gala
Never got to wear but very soft
links_reviews_text: Good quality. Did not go with the dress I imagined wearing it with but it was very cute and would rent again
Was too warm in Dallas to wear out as I had planned. Would rent again.
This jacket was SOOO soft and warm while still looking very cute.

I loved this jacket so much I want to buy it. I wore this to a party over a dress and it was so warm yet classy. I'm a size 4, 5'7" and 125lbs and the Medium fit great. I could've even worn a small I think. Would 100% recommend. Navy was gorgeoussssssss!
Ordered a small because I didn't want it to be too bulky and that was a good decision but the sleeves do run a little short. Very cute, lots of compliments.
Loved so much I decided to purchase. not too bulky which i see with alot of fur coats.

links_reviews_title: Amazing coat, but color definitely has a blue-ish tint, not true black, more of a dark navy hue.
links_reviews_text: Warm, good fit, comfy and cute, but it's not true black.

links_reviews_title: Blue not black but super cozy
links_reviews_text: Enjoyed wearing this a couple times even though I had originally thought it was black and not blue. Pretty. Nice fit. Very soft and comfortable.
super soft, nice cropped length. will probably buy but keeping all winter even if I don't.

This is the best jacket of all time! It was definitely a more boxy fit, but I actually went up a size because they didn't have XS available and I loved it. I would recommend going up actually if you want to wear it as outerwear and not just a fashion jacket.

I'm having trouble sending this coat back. The short teddy texture is so cuddly, it has pockets but not large enough to securely hold a phone. It runs a bit big but that leaves room for layers. Love it!

I absolutely loved this jacket. It was comfortable enough that I wore it throughout my entire day without taking it off. It was absolutely perfect for spring weather! The color is fantastic in person too.

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it!
links_reviews_text: Great jacket, beautiful color! It's warm but not too bulky, loved the fit. Can't wait to wear again

Nice quality, kept me warm on cooling late autumn days. The green has blue undertones that will really make your hair color pop if you're blonde/dirty blonde. A fun color I wouldn't have normally tried but glad I did! Cozy chic low key
Love
Super warm and true to size. Felt a little boxy/bulky for me, but wore it once and it was cute.
Received so many compliments on this jacket! Perfect for a weekend in San Francisco.
Love this jacket for a crisp fall day. The color is vibrant and the jacket is super warm! Will definitely rent again to switch my looks up since the style is similar to a denim jacket.

Loved this sweatshirt and got a lot of compliments! I tend to buy neutrals so it's always fun to rent something bright and colorful. The lining was soft and the sleeves were fun so you could wear it out and be super comfortable bht still feel slightly dressed up

Wore this for a casual family get-together. Comfortable and cute. Sleeves were a little shorter than I would have liked, but not too short. You do have to go with high waisted denim as it is a crop top!

It was slightly oversized but that was what I was going for and I thought it looked great. I got loads of compliments everywhere I went! It was super cozy and I loved the balloon sleeves. Thinking about purchasing for sure!
Full sleeves & fit to ripped, cropped waist.
Great fit. Fun sleeves. It is a bit of a crop top on me but it might just be due to my long torso. This was very fun for a holiday party.
Warm, soft, and great detail.
Loved this sweatshirt. I should have sized down, but I like sweatshirts baggy. A large would have been big on me, could have gone with a medium. I was too lazy to exchange.
Perfect for petite girls - cropped with cute billowing detail on the sleeve and mock turtleneck
This fit great and was a comfy sweatshirt to wear to work.

links_reviews_title: Great fit and pop of color
links_reviews_text: Very cute cut and fit. Comfortable and flattering. I wore with a long white knit skirt. Received lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: My unforgettable event was going to work.
links_reviews_text: It's nothing special. Just a sweatshirt. Little short in the torso.
I knew that was cropped, but I thought since I'm on the shorter side it wouldn't be too cropped on me. I was wrong. I wanted to love it, but it just wasn't my style.

links_reviews_title: Fancy Sweatshirt if that's a thing?
links_reviews_text: This sweatshirt is super comfy and fun. The pleated arms make it.
This sweatshirt is SO comfortable and the style adds enough to be 'dressed' up for everyday wear and work. It's flattering and the red is beautifully bright. One of my favorite pieces so far.

links_reviews_title: Super cute sweater for every day!
links_reviews_text: Great sweater that you can dress up or down. Love the sleeves on it.
Very comfortable and a beautiful red
Beautiful red, super soft inside, hung nicely. I wore this a few times before sending back!
Pretty cute and easy to wear. Ran a tad bit large so will be returning for a smaller size. Would rent again to wear with jeans and joggers.
The dress is well-made and fit nicely. It is very work appropriate and uber conservative.
Lightweight dress that is more suitable for summer / early fall. I layered with a long sleeved T shirt but didn't love the look. Would rent again for summer.
Very pretty dress. Thought it would feel a little stretchier and tighter on some areas like a bondage dress like in the chest and stomach but very pretty
An unexpected beauty! Great fabric, nice fit and such a flattering cut! I highly recommend renting!

links_reviews_title: Fit perfect but dressier fabric than expected
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress to a real estate closing. Colorado is a pretty casual state so I felt a tad over dressed but I put a cardigan on to dress it down a bit. It fit perfectly and was not too low cut so no need for a camisole underneath.
This fit was great! I'm typically between a 0 and 2 and the 0 in this dress was perfect for me. Very flattering shape and very thick material. Super well made!

links_reviews_title: Classy dress for the office and to wear with a blazer
links_reviews_text: I am wearing a size 2 but probably could have gotten away with a 0. Not too form fitting like another shoshanna dress I tried on. Cute with blazer
Very comfortable and flattering. Perfect for work where you look professional and can survive the heat and humidity.
Great work option. Not too tight or short, great flounce and neckline. Expensive fabric and nice color.
Wore this to client meetings today and it was perfect. The fabric is elegant. I felt great in it.

links_reviews_title: Stretchy but not super flattering on me
links_reviews_text: Tried on but didn't wear

links_reviews_title: Fun and sporty take on work wear
links_reviews_text: I rented this for work. The style is cute and sporty but still professional. Dress arrived new with tags, which is always fun! The material is thick and stretchy but not very tight or binding

links_reviews_title: Nice fabric and cute cut but way too small
links_reviews_text: This runs quite small. I felt like I was trying to get into a wetsuit because it was so fitted and with the thick and slightly stretchy fabric. I did like the cut but felt like I would need to go up two sizes for it to be comfortable. Not made for anyone with curves.
thick material stretchy fabric fits snug

links_reviews_title: Nice dress, high-quality, good for work event
links_reviews_text: The dress fit very nicely, the fabric is high-quality, true to size. I wore it to an evening work event.
It's tight on the stomach like those bandage dresses but then flares on the bottom - not for me

Good thick material. Fitted through the torso with skirt hitting just above the knee. I loved how the top was full coverage with no room for a wardrobe malfunction, and I didn’t have to adjust it throughout the day.
This was a little too long on me (but i'm only 5 feet) so it fell just below the knee and it looked a little bit awkward. But overall still cute for work!
Flattering design

links_reviews_title: Looked great, sleek lines, very comfy
links_reviews_text: Great fit!
A little big but was good for work, not too form fitting but creates a nice silhouette.
This is nicely fitted and nothing flashy, good for when you want to look polished but aren't trying to steal a show. I felt super confident in it, wore it to a party and to work.

links_reviews_title: It is flattering, professional, just an overall great dress for work. I also wore it with a blazer.
links_reviews_text: fabric is pretty thick, navy blue, stylish, fitted at waist
I wore this dress for work and the fabric is substantial & beautiful. The cut is very flattering and made my waist look tiny. Would definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: Love the fit and very flattering.
links_reviews_text: The material is amazing-so comfortable and flattering

links_reviews_title: Style did not work on me
links_reviews_text: Style did not work on me

links_reviews_title: fits great, fabric is easy to clean and stretchy/comfoy
links_reviews_text: great dress
Great dress for work. Flattering fit.

links_reviews_title: Best material, really flattering, would love to own!
links_reviews_text: Loved wearing this!! The quality of the fabric is amazing (somewhat bandage material) and it fits like a glove. I would love to own it if I could afford it - it would be a go to! Will 10000% rent again.
Got tons of compliments on fit and fabric. High enough neck for my chest - which is hard to find in a v-neck dress. Would definitely rent again!
Love this dress.
Beautiful dress, should have ordered one size smaller

links_reviews_title: Nice for work or going out
links_reviews_text: Good quality
Fit great looked great.

links_reviews_title: Loved this dress hides every flaw
links_reviews_text: Hi I'm going out with the dress I love it

Cute little navy work dress in a nice knit. The material feels expensive and the cut is flattering. I have a small waist, full hips and thighs, a 36 B bust, stand 5'5" and 165 lbs. Your waist/stomach needs to be relatively flat as the design emphasizes the waist. I wore Spanx with it to smooth out my silhouette. Falls into a sassy flounce at the hem and lands an inch or two above the knee. Nice for work and a night out.
So cute and perfect for work -- flattering in the butt too. Runs a tad large but totally doable

This dress was super comfortable. I wore it to work with a mustard color cardigan. I love the little flare at the bottom. Material was stretchy but not skin tight. Would consider buying as an everyday piece - can be dressed up for drinks or dressed down for the weekend.
A little bit large for me. I will try 2 size next time
I recommend getting with the matching set!

links_reviews_title: Made it work but... she CLINGS
links_reviews_text: Incredibly unflattering. Material is nice but wow.
The material on this skirt feels substantial without being heavy. It was perfect for a rainy spring day. I'm considering buying this one because I loved it!

Be very careful about your underwear choice! With the white panels and how formfitting it is, you can see everything. I went with nude shapewear shorts after trying a lot. Also if you want to tuck in your top, watch out for lines since it's so fitted in the hips. Other than that, loved it!

links_reviews_title: Best for someone with a slender figure
links_reviews_text: The white side of the material showed the lines of my seamless underwear and the edge of the sweater I tucked in. I tried With the sweater tucked out, it looked too baggy. Emphasized to many lumps. Did not wear.
This was so fun with a black turtleneck and high black boots. So many compliments. Thought about buying it. Flattering fit, great length. Loved it.
Loved this - I wore with the matching top and it was form fitting but quite flattering, fancy and elegant. Got so many compliments. Definitely wore spanx under, but glad I got M not L
Would rent again. Usually freezing in office and was so cozy in this ensemble.
Loved this skirt. So easy to wear and fun.
Everything is nice and conservative... wore to Sunday mass... I wouldn't wear it again but it made me feel pretty Beautiful colors

links_reviews_title: beautiful design but not very flattering
links_reviews_text: This was a very unforgiving style, making me look lumpy or flat in all the wrong ways. Perhaps I got a size too small.
I got many compliments I wore it with it's matching piece, would rent again!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful colors, not a lot of shape
links_reviews_text: The colors are really pretty however the shape was pretty limp. The photo actually shows it well - it very relaxed as the bottom, I was hoping for more structure.
This outfit - get the whole set - is a head turner. I love the fit, the fabric, and the mood.
Fit well but needs a leotard or something underneath-nothing with buttons. Too dramatic to wear 2x
I was really on the fence about this so I didn't wear it. It was just OK.

Very nice skirt. The colored panels add a nice touch and one of the panels is actually a Forest Green (it looks like black in the picture) so I was able to break out a blazer that I sometimes have trouble matching. I felt like I looked put together for work without the drab of navy blue or black
Wore with matching turtleneck. I received many compliments.
Fitted and sleek.
This skirt was really fun to wear. I wore it with a nice T-shirt and blazer for work. It is a type of knot so it clings to the tummy.

links_reviews_title: Got lots of compliments at work!
links_reviews_text: Looks polished yet is very comfy.

links_reviews_title: Very elegant, my husband said I reminded him of Claire Underwood
links_reviews_text: I wore this with a plain black top for an understated, elegant and yet slightly edgy look.
Couldnt wear it! Was way too tight around my butt. BUT! I kind of knew it would be tough when I ordered. A medium would have been perfect

I loved this skirt and wore it several times. To church with a tight sweater and boots, to brunch and errands with an oversized sweater and sneakers, and to a meeting with a slim cut tee and heels. I couldn't believe the number of ways I could wear it, and I got compliments every time. The colors are really pretty and vibrant, yet this skirt felt like a neutral piece because it went so well with everything. Will rent again!!
Such a great skirt! Very comfortable and flattering. Received so many compliments when I wore this to work. The pattern on the skirt is very slimming and the length was perfect for my short frame

links_reviews_title: Unique outfit appropriate for many occasions!
links_reviews_text: Fit very well, snug and thick material and pairs perfectly with the skirt. Best worn as a set.
This was really soft and easy to wear. I liked that it was a fun pattern without being too over the top for my conservative work place.
Great fit! Perfect midi length.
I wore it to work. It was a little too long. Fabric is thick and nice.
Stretchy material is forgiving
Looked great with matching top

I really liked this skirt! I didn't rent the matching top because I thought it might be too much. I styled it with a black long sleeve t-shirt, moto style black leather jacket and black booties. The knit is substantial and the color blocking gives it a modern vibe. The knit is stretchy and it grew during the full day of wear. It didn't look loose or baggy though.

This skirt is very form fitting and the fabric is not forgiving. I should have ordered a L (I normally wear a 6-8), because the M was so tight on my hips that even with shapewear it just showed too much. I wanted it to work as it goes SO WELL with the matching Tory Sport turtleneck (which is TTS).
Looked great with colorful pants
Super cute take on the classic white work shirt. Thin material and wrinkles very easily, so definitely need to iron before wearing
Felt like a sloppy,wrinkled mess. Shirt ran large for me and I felt extremely unpolished and sloppy at work. Will not rent again.
I loved this shirt and I normally wear a 6 so I got it in a 6. Everything fit fine but it was so tight in my arms.
Fits well, the tie is nice so you can fit it to your body. But it does not stay crisp, it gets wrinkly easily.

links_reviews_title: Loved this and almost bought it! Great for work but could also be great for casual looks.
links_reviews_text: Flattering at the waist.

links_reviews_title: Amazing top but wrinkles a lot
links_reviews_text: I rented this top 2 times already and wore it to work. Really love it! However the fabric wrinkles a lot. Size: true to size but on the large side

links_reviews_title: Picture looked better /wish was more oversized
links_reviews_text: Picture looked better /wish was more oversized
The front tie of the shirt was a nice touch and a cool variation on the white button down shirt. Perfect for spring

links_reviews_title: Loved the look but very wrinkly
links_reviews_text: I loved the look and style. It was a great upgrade to a normal white button up and not too hot in the warm Florida weather. My only complaint is that it wrinkles so easily. It really needs to be starched. I steamed everything out and it was wrinkled the next minute. It's supposed to look crisp and clean but I looked like a wrinkly mess all day.

This is a great, goes with everything shirt. It is full in the front, and cinched with a front belt. I liked this shirt, but I could have sized down due to the fullness. There is a lot of fabric to pull in. Sleeves were a perfect length. I would wear this again.
Perfect fit- TTS! Very flattering. I had to iron it, but that's the nature of the material. Only con is it's a little see through.
Looked a bit like a maternity shirt...
Cute, but not flattering in and hard to find the right bottoms to wear with it.

I went up a size as that was what was available and the self tie made it so that it looked like it fit normally. Very flattering/forgiving and professional enough for work but relaxed enough to wear on the weekend as well.
Perfect for work! Playful and sharp
Cute sweatshirt. The neck was slightly stretched out though
I like the colors. It's a little on the short side hut fine with higher rise bottoms!
Wore with high waisted jean cutoffs - was the perfect trendy sweatshirt to throw on once it got cold at a bbq I was throwing.
A step up from your basic casual sweater. Not too hot either.
I wish I had sized up for more length.
Adorable sweatshirt. Slightly cropped.
Everyone loves this sweater. A bit cropped, but still appropriate for those of us not in our 20s or even 30s.

Was just the right crop for me, but I'm just 5 feet. If you're taller or have a short torso it's going to be very very short. I wore a tucked in tank underneath because I wore it to school. Overall, cute, but fine to wear once and send back. Nothing special

This was such a great bright fun sweatshirt to wear for every day wear. I would say it fits true to size and is very cropped, but I love the style. Thought twice about purchasing but didn't. I'd recommend. Great for a cabin weekend or lounging around on the weekend. I got tons of compliments at the grocery store actually!! Good quality. I probably could have sized up but the xs worked well, too!

links_reviews_title: Want to keep! Comfy Cute Crop!
links_reviews_text: So cute and so many compliments. It is not very warm so good for a Fall day or summer night. Love this though.

links_reviews_title: Fun way to mix up a fall wardrobe
links_reviews_text: Wore this many times while on vacation. Nice cropped style. Good for light layer in 60 degree weather
Lightweight coverup great to pair with white jeans for a chilly day

links_reviews_title: Nice print but just not for me
links_reviews_text: Just like the photo- cropped, slightly boxy sweatshirt. Loved the print. Unfortunately just looked wrong on me- maybe better for someone younger? My husband said it looked like something I pulled out of the closet from my Middle School days :(.
Im usually a medium, for some reason a L was sent. A bit big, but its boxy anyway.
Recommend to rent for casual wear

links_reviews_title: One of my very favorite rentals yet!
links_reviews_text: I was so tempted to keep this sweater (if only I beach vacationed more often!). This is a great quality sweatshirt. It is definitely cropped, so beware if you are tall. Still thinking about how I wish I bought it :)

This was definitely a statement sweatshirt, and the pattern was so gorgeous (and bold) that both of my kids remarked on it (my 8 year old daughter begged me to buy it)! It wasn’t a super soft & cozy sweatshirt, but paired with my yellow Rebecca Minkoff joggers it most def elevated my loungewear game. Shirt is short, but not cropped (I am 5’5’’) and not very thick. Would rent again!
I would have worn this if it wasn't such a high crop top. With as wide as it is, it's a very boxy look with how high cut it is.
This was not as cute in person and much more cropped then expected. Ended up not wearing.
Everything you could want in a cropped sweatshirt :) The fit was great and I loved the bright color. Would recommend.

links_reviews_title: While I rented this to putz around town as daily wear, I was shocked at the neverending compliments.
links_reviews_text: Boxy, cropped (but not too cropped, no belly button action), bright, fresh, comfortable. Great with jeans, leggings, joggers - so easy to wear!
Great for a causal day with jeans or leggings. Love love the pattern. Quality is a bit itchy

links_reviews_title: This was a fun shirt for Saturday errands and get togethers with friends and family.
links_reviews_text: It is a bit cropped but with higher fit jeans it was not an issue. I wore a red camisole underneath.

The fabric is beautiful and I love the trim. The only complaint is that is is really short. I'm 5'2" and it hit at my waist. I wore a white tank top under the sweatshirt and high waisted jeans to make it work.

The sweater shirt looked like it had been worn quite a few times or I just didn't hold up well. It was more cropped than I thought it would be. It didn't really look good with any of my high waisted yoga pants

links_reviews_title: I liked this for the most part.
links_reviews_text: I liked the print. The material was a little stiff. It came with some dark scuff marks on it though which was very disappointing.

links_reviews_title: It was perfect for a day party with my friends!
links_reviews_text: It is definitely cropped, but i wore it with higher denim and it looked great. I couldnt have worn it with jeans that sat lower than high rise
The sleeves are too long for me but I am petite. I'm going to try the Medium to see if it helps.
Great top with jeans. Made the everyday look brighter

links_reviews_title: Great sweatshirt that doesn't look like a sweatshirt.
links_reviews_text: Boxy, cropped fit. Wore it several times and received compliments every time.
Really cute sweatshirt. The material is thick which makes it feel like a quality garment, but lightweight enough for summer wear. Would rent again!

links_reviews_title: Loved it but never wore bc weather was too hot.
links_reviews_text: So trendy
run short so make sure to wear high pants/jeans with it unless you want your midriff showing.

links_reviews_title: Great colors. Chic, easy and casual.
links_reviews_text: When you want to be comfortable but not dreary, this sweatshirt is for you. I adore the floral print. Fits as one would expect a sweatshirt would. Casual, easy and fun.

links_reviews_title: Fun, colorful sweatshirt so unexpected that people love it!
links_reviews_text: Of all my pieces this month, this was my favorite, but it was (even after discount) a little too pricey to justify. Still, I love wearing this with jeans, pairing it with under Ts in complementary colors. It was really a cool, updated way to dress casually. And I'll be on the lookout for similar pieces in the future. Loved wearing this.
Received a ton of compliments. Wore it as a casual summer sweatshirt with ripped jean shorts.

links_reviews_title: Very cute, a lot of compliments, a little short in the body
links_reviews_text: Very cute, a lot of compliments, a little short in the body
I was worried that this sweatshirt would be kind of weird but I LOVED it. It's a great cropped length and went really well with high-waisted pants.

links_reviews_title: i dont know what to put here because i didnt wear it
links_reviews_text: i am very tall so it was too short. otherwise so cute and wish i could have worn but my body is just too dang long
So comfy and chic. The colors are amazing. So fun to wear on the weekend!
Super cute pants that are perfect for fall or spring. They're very high waisted though and slightly tighter around the hips for pear shaped women.
Very fun, high-waisted pant. Ran a little on the tight side, but I think that's the look!
These are snug but comfortable pants. High waisted with a very slight pink hue to them. There a nice piece to try for a little something different.

links_reviews_title: Unique and modern take on a classic pant
links_reviews_text: I really loved these pants and will probably rent again! The high waist and button detailing were exciting and fun without being over the top. I found them to run a tiny bit small, but were very comfy all day at work. The fabric is more beautiful in person than the photos would suggest. I'd recommend! Come check out my YouTube channel (Pointe Boutique) for more details about this and all of my other rentals!

I wore the pants to work and thought the result was alright. The main issue is I'm pretty short-waisted so I needed to pull the pants down to keep it from sitting directly under my chest. When I did that, I had a bit extra material in the crotch. It would have been perfect for me if they had cut about 3" from the waist line. Comfy material.

links_reviews_title: A few inches too big on the waist
links_reviews_text: Cute pants, were too big on the waist, probably by 2-3 inches. Would probably work if I was 6 inches taller.
These pants are super adorable in person and love the comfort of them. Wore the pants as conservative outfit for a graduate school recruitment event. Channeling my inner future professor look.

These pants were very comfortable. Plenty of room without being tight, but true to size. The pattern is actually black, peach and beige which makes the pants look brown in the picture. Very high-waisted, which I loved, and the band at the top accentuated the waist. Great for work!

Lately, I haven't been able to find a pair of slacks that fit me. Vanity sizing has become rampant in many brands and even their size 0 is quite large on me. These pants fit like a glove! They're not too tight but I also don't worry about them stretching in the waist. The print is very flattering and they hit right above the ankle (many times pants are too short for me).

links_reviews_title: These pants are great for going from the office to dinner
links_reviews_text: The high waist is great and the button detail is what makes these pants.
Fit perfect in all the right places.

Great for Apple shaped individuals! Love these pants! I'm usually a size 6 but got my secondary size since size 6 was unavailable. If I got size 6 I probably would not be able to fit it. I had to fold pants up once more to have a better fit/look since I'm short. Comfortable pants that's look professional and chic. Payed with a black Gap basic tee.
Love the look of these pants I just don't think they worked for my body shape. The material is stretchy, just something about the shape wasn't complimenting for me
Fun alternative to normal Boring workpants

links_reviews_title: Good enough to wear once to work
links_reviews_text: The pants were comfortable, a little loose, and cute enough. I probably wouldn't rent them again unless I needed something high waist. I am between 2 and 4, but the 2 was unavailable. 4 was a bit loose on me.

Not much stretch for curvier hips but fit nice and snug and looked great! Really love the color and pattern. Sitting down was a bit awkward as the high waist is veryyyy high waisted but didn't bother me too much after a little while.
Amazing fit for people that need some slimming in rear and thighs. Look very cool and stylish

I typically have trouble finding pants that fit well but these pants fit perfectly! They were the perfect length and fit comfortably through my legs, hips, and waist. The fabric doesn't feel expensive but the high waist and button detail put a spin on your typical work pant.
I bought these because they are so comfortable and the perfect work pants. Have paired them with boots, flats and heels and can be dressed up or down. True to size and very flattering at the waist!
Loved these pants. I will totally wear them again. They were cropped perfectly for my 5'3" frame. I wore them with an olive green peplum shirt and Madewell booties. So cute!
Too small, didn't wear.

links_reviews_title: I love the way the top buttons and the hips fit perfectly.
links_reviews_text: If you plan on eating anything, you will feel restricted in the abdominal area. Just order a size up if you like room to move!

These pants are amazing, great for an hour glass figure if your waist tends to be a bit smaller than your hips. Really soft stretch material so they weren't uncomfortable sitting in an office all. Highly recommend!!
Very cute pants, but the waist is very small. I would size up when ordering.
Very cute, flatters a small waist! Length was perfect on me as they went just over my ankle booties!

My usual size was way too big. There was gapping at the waist and the legs/butt were saggy. Unfortunately the pants also made my legs look shorter. I suspect if I had the right size the pants would be great, but I decided just to return them and not try for a smaller size.
Great fit. Cute. Brown and light pink.

links_reviews_title: Did not get to wear it.
links_reviews_text: not a good fit for my body type.
Due to my own error, ordered wrong size. Will definitely reorder right size to try again though
This pant is a classic line and color works with many tops. The high waist is tight when you sit, but looks good standing. The pants were not too tight and the fabric was nice.
Soft and very comfortable
Not a thick houndstooth material. Material is thin, and unflattering
Would highly recommend these pants. They are so comfortable and so stylish. Also, so flattering. I loved these pants and would consider buying them.
Those were formal side of clothing, couldn't figure out how to rock those pants.
I loved the high waist and retro styling.
Fit is good
Pants were great but one of the buttons were loose and fell off. A simple needle and thread could fix them but otherwise great fit and true to size - very stylish and comfortable.
The fit was okay, they were a little big but manageable. The style is cute but not something I would choose again.
Perfect fit, no give. Length perfect, paired with ankle boots. Room in calves while being tapered and fitted.
Perfect fit got lots of compliments when worn to the office.

Loved this top! The wrinkling situation was unfortunate but it took a while for that to happen. I styled it with these giant jeans and a sweet navy and yellow plaid Milly overcoat. Comfy and cute but you will need a tank or other top beneath because of large armholes!

links_reviews_title: FYI it's gold sparkle, not mustard yellow
links_reviews_text: Outside of the color not being exactly what I thought, still felt like this was a great, stretchy work from home dress! I post outfits daily on my insta mama_cassss - feel free to follow.
Comfy and fits well

Loved the rich gold color. Was very form fitting and not my favorite material (was thick and not soft) but not uncomfortable. This was such a standout dress that I had a hard time returning it! I paired it with my Pom Pom booties and leather jacket. Will rent again.

I LOVED this dress. Fit my body like a glove. Great holiday/party dress because yellow has slight glitter. The fabric is great quality and perfect for cold winter days. Both times I wore this dress, strangers would stop me on the sidewalk to compliment the dress! It made me feel like a supermodel!
Wore this on two outings and got many compliments! Wore with high heel ankle boots and then with flat boots. It's gold and black, not yellow.

Fits like a glove, but not too tight. Flattering while still feeling conservative enough for work. Worked it with a black velvet bow in my hair and black leather ankle boots at the holidays. Great alternative to red.

This wool and METAL mock turtleneck dress was an absolute hit. Everyone at work loved it. It was warm, comfy, and easy to move in. The fabric is heavy and perfect for those 60° fall days. The pattern was surprisingly slimming! I will absolutely be renting this one again.

links_reviews_title: This dress made me feel like a supermodel!
links_reviews_text: Words cannot describe how much I love this dress. It clung to all the right places and with a little shapewear to smooth everything out I felt gorgeous! I got complements everywhere I went and my husband was gaga for the dress. I wore this on a day when I had a huge meeting and I felt so confident. Rent this one for sure!

This was a body con fit with gold metallic details. The color is very rich and saturated, and the fabric moves absolutely beautifully. I felt like an icon in this dress and strangers went out of their way to give me compliments.

Some day I am sure that reviews will be attributed to the user. Until then know that I love a muumuu. This knit dress is essentially a chic muumuu. I originally rented this to wear to the office but plans change, moms get lazy, and calls start at 6a when you live on the west coast. My point is this was PERFECT for working from home! I woke up for that hella early video call and threw this dress on with some red lipstick ET VOILA- perfectly chic at 6a with no effort. My spouse felt it was a little to Salt-n-Peppa circa 1987 (he started pelvic thrusting and singing Push It). He meant it as an insult because he doesn't realize that the 80s are back with a fierceness that's cooler than the Cold War. I styled this with black ugg slippers at home and with a gold tassel necklace and black booties when I was in public.
I wore this to work and literally the first thing I heard was "wow, that's not a dress...that's a moment!" Transitioned from day to night so well. Nonstop compliments!
I took size up, to have softer draping thru waist & hips, its aged GOLD- not yellow , but its not over the too, very striking,loved it
Can't tell but the yellow is shiny gold color
Beautiful knit and fun pattern but not cut for petites

links_reviews_title: Wore this while walking around Italy on vacation
links_reviews_text: Not too tight but still form fitting. Is warm material but not too thick that you'll be sweating if indoors.

links_reviews_title: Not expecting the yellow to be metallic gold but hey, my fault for not reading the product details!
links_reviews_text: Really good comfortable fit and does not get stretched out of shape!
I wore for everyday wear. Shimmery gold make dress look more formal, but comfortable to wear anywhere. Hugs the body. Not loose. There's nice weight to the fabric. Photographs well.
Amazing dress! So comfortable and worked great for holiday party and work! It is very flattering. I would highly recommend this dress! I am struggling to return it!

I love a good sweater dress! I was worried this would be itchy because of the wool but it's so soft. The gold has a little sparkle in it so it's really pretty. I took off a star because it's a bit too long on my 5'4 frame.
The dress was beautiful and fit wonderfully. I could have sized down but prefer a looser fit for work. The materials was a little thinner and shinier than I expected but it still looked great.
I loved wearing this. It's made of a nice, thick material that both accentuates your curves and smooths away any lumps. I was complimented nonstop.
This dress was awesome for a winter wedding. I am 5'3, 125lbs and wore the medium. It is very form fitting so spanx were a necessity for me but it fit well and the fabric was stretchy.

Sized up for comfort and still found this garment right and uncomfortable, especially in the neck, shoulders and chest area. Garment is heavy and warm, but after trying it on I returned it without wearing it.
Love the sparkly gold fabric! Wore to work with leather jacket to dress down. Could definitely be great for fancier occasion!

Loved this dress! I wore to work and it looked great. Very fashion forward. I did not feel like me in it though I received quite a few compliments so not sure I would rent again. This is why I love RTR you try things you never would buy!
Its perfect! I might buy it!
Comfortable, thick and heavy, quality, gorgeous material.
Fit well and comfortable
Great dress for cold time. Very warm. Can be dress up or down.

links_reviews_title: Great for people who work in fashion.
links_reviews_text: Fit well. Material is a little itchy but beautiful.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress, fit well. Its a great work to evening dress.
links_reviews_text: The dress was fitted, though no so much that any lumps showed. The hem, sleeves, everything were perfect length.
The yellow is actually a dirty mustard color. Also check out the material I don't like it.
LOVED wearing this. Warm but not too thick. Got lots of compliments. I'm usually small but I get medium in this brand. I'm short so hit closer to my ankles.

links_reviews_title: Love this dress! Perfect for cold weather and work events.
links_reviews_text: I'm 26 weeks pregnant and this dress fit perfectly for a work event. Really warm and great fabric, a little on the heavier side, but it's made of great quality.

I loved this dress. It's so comfortable and the tan color in the plaid is actually a metallic gold that gives it this subtle elevated feel. I wore it to a relaxed winter birthday brunch and it was perfect, the little glint made it feel worthy of a party while I was warm and cozy and looked great the whole time. I definitely should have gotten it in the small even with my wider hips, and even though I'm tall it was a bit longer than I expected after seeing the pictures. It would have been even more flattering if I went down a size, but looked fine in the medium as that's all that was available when I rented it.
WARNING!!!! This dress has METAL FIBERS. I went on a plane in it. Body Search WAS necessary. Don't wear on a plane.
The sparkly gold of this dress is a great way to dress up the most casual of plaids. This is a very form-fitting dress, as noted in other reviews, but the thick fabric hid lumps and bumps.

links_reviews_title: This dress looks and feels very expensive. It's classic and also really warm.
links_reviews_text: Very form fitting, long on my 5'3" frame but looked great with a pair of black booties

links_reviews_title: The many compliments I received and the way the dress fit me perfectly.
links_reviews_text: True to size

This coat was super cute and on trend this season, but docking 1 star because it wasn't the best quality. The material was a little in-expensive and the lining wasn't the best- but again overall nailed the trend!

links_reviews_title: Great casual coat. Warm yet lightweight and very comfy, cozy.
links_reviews_text: Warm yet lightweight and very comfy, cozy. True to size. I was able to comfortably layer a thin cashmere sweater underneath and was comfortable in 40-50 degrees.

links_reviews_title: Great color/texture, but not warm enough.
links_reviews_text: Loved the rich caramel color and soft teddy texture of this coat, but it's a little too basic for me — definitely not worth the $200 full retail. Shallow pockets, only one snap closure, and unlined, so would only recommend in places warmer than 55°F.
I did not end up wearing this because it was very thin (for a Northeast winter). I also have an athletic build and the shape of the coat did not fit me well. It was too tight in the hips.
Pretty basic quality but cute.

links_reviews_title: Rented this to wear over the holidays.
links_reviews_text: Loved this jacket so much that I bought it. Beautiful color and very flattering fit. A little snug in the arms.
Loved this jacket. Fit was just the right amount of 'oversized '. The inside lining wasn't the best but still wore this almost every day during my rental month.

My favorite thing about wintertime is renting a variety of fun coats! This jacket was a similar silhouette to the ones I've been enjoying this season and I thought I'd give it a shot. In comparison to the pink fuzzy Kate Spade it was thin and honestly felt pretty cheap. It was tight in the armpits. I did wear it a few times and it's super cute! Maybe just not the quality I have come to expect from RTR

I had lots of fun wearing this coat but bear in mind that it is unlined fleece, not faux fur. Warm enough for November with a sweater underneath, but I wouldn't recommend it for winter unless you are in a mild climate.
Cute, boxy but in a good way, soft. The pockets are shallow and it's not super warm but it's great for fall.
Super nice coat- warm and comfy. Could be worn both casual and business.
Not very high quality quality, fairly thin so wouldn't be good for very cold weather. Didn't love this, felt cheaply made

This is maybe one of the coolest pieces I've ever rented. The fit is purposely large and the structure is on trend and looks crisp. Could easily transition from a "business b" office dress code to dinner and absorb endless compliments in both settings.

This coat is gorgeous and feels amazing BUT it is way way way too oversized! I couldn't wear it out. It was ridiculous on me. Also even if sized down I think it's more of a nice coat than a long blazer. Just FYI.

This is such a beautiful jacket!! The lining is stunning and the fabric is super high quality. I never would have risked a purchase like this through an online store -- so renting it was the perfect option! And I'm so glad I did. I'm short so it was a nice length on me. I don't have broad shoulders but I'm not always a true XS, so I would say it runs a touch big. It was super comfortable and I wish I could have kept it! If you're on the fence - rent it! It's a unique standout.

Absolutely obsessed with this jacket, the amount I don't want to give it back is too high. So so gorgeous in person, definitely looks luxe. I'd say it fits similar to the Madewell Caldwell blazer (fitted in shoulders - though this one has shoulder pads too - and oversized in the body) But the cut of the body is to die for! Oversized but so slimming, makes for a really sleek silhouette. I'd stick with your normal size or size down. I've worn to brunch, happy hour, girls night, it's a workhorse.

What a gorgeous piece! I received so many compliments on this and don't want to send it back! After reading reviews it typically wear a small or medium for an oversized fit. Small wasn't available so I went with an xs and it fit perfectly!

I liked this jacket and would probably consider renting again. I wore it to the office with a black sheath dress underneath and also to happy hour with a camisole and black leggings. I'm normally a size 4–6 in tops and rented the small, but it was pretty oversized. I liked the look and high quality feel.

Incredible jacket. Got so many compliments- wore it both on date night, and at work with some skinny ankle pants and heeled booties. It definitely runs BIG - I'm 5'11", typically wear large, and the medium was roomy on me.

Loads of compliments, I wore this to a holiday party over faux leather leggings. Note it is heavy and oversized, but it's super cool. I maybe could have sized down ... note, there are no buttons to wear it closed
This coat/blazer reminded me of a coat my nana had. A bit on the larger size, but liked the oversize look rather than being tight/ fitted. Lots of compliments too!

links_reviews_title: Wore to a holiday party. Just a really fun jacket. Tons of compliments.
links_reviews_text: fits really nicely. Pretty warm.

I loved this jacket. Rented it for a work gala where I wanted to be formal but still somewhat business appropriate. The fabric is even more beautiful in person. I pinned the jacket closed to give it more shape since it is very oversized. You definitely want to pair it with slim pants or jeans.

If I had a dollar for every compliment I got white wearing this blazer, I'D BE SO RICH!! It's seriously so fabulous. Do not pass this up!! I was hesitant to rent an oversized blazer because I'm pretty wide in my shoulders (Former bodybuilder) but GIRL!!!! This was designed so flawlessly that even if you see broader up top, you won't look like a big box. It's stunning and you will love wearing it multiple t times!!
It was definitely oversized but still flattering. It was perfect for my birthday dinner and I received a ton of compliments.
Definitely oversized so I had to wear it with skinny jeans to offset but tons of compliments and very comfortable.
This blazer is truly beautiful. Love the material and quality. Wore it 3x wanted to buy will rent again.

Shoulder pads! Oversized silhouette! Detail at the sleeve! Beautiful fabric! It's so good! I loved this jacket. Wore it twice - both to chic dinners - and felt on trend as well as appropriate. No pockets but who cares *shrug*

links_reviews_title: Stand out coat for an early Spring event
links_reviews_text: This coat was a great piece to wear to a Womens networking event. I would recommend sizing down as this runs very large. The fabric is so think, and beautiful floral pattern that it was great for an early spring event. The only issue is that the lapels didn't want to lay flat, so I added a black belt to give it some shape and kept the lapels in order. Overall it was really fun to pair with a black blouse, skinny jeans and booties.

This oversized blazer was absolutely beautiful in person! It is VERY oversized, which I loved! I wore it twice, once paired with jeans and then with bike shorts. I received SO many compliments on this piece!
Beautiful. Loved the fabric and the fit. It's oversized for sure. Went a size down and still ran big. Was great for work. Would be great for wearing out, too.
True to size oversized jacket. Beautiful fabric and details. Love it!

I'm petite and this fit me on the edge of over sized. I was expecting it though so it was perfect. It made my simple LBD and booties outfit really pop. I was in my third trimester but I still ordered my normal size and it was fine. Fun piece to play with.

I decided to size down for this oversized jacket so it wouldn't overwhelm my frame and I am glad I did. I am usually a small, occasionally a medium and I went XS. I paired this with a black top and black skinny jeans and green heels to dress it down for a work event and felt confident and stylish. I liked it but probably wouldn't rent it again.
I loved everything about this jacket. I wore it to a new years party and to work. It's VERY oversized and long...and also perfect. This is one of my favorite Rent the Runways yet!

Definitely oversized, so size down if you want it fitted. I absolutely love this blazer, I looks great dressed up or down. I would definitely rent it again if I have another event to go to, especially one where I'm photographed a lot, because the blazer is just THAT good looking!
The print gives this oversized jacket a vintage vibe but the shoulder pads makes it edgy. Size down

I became so obsessed w/ this jacket a rtr event that I signed up for Unlimited just to wear it again. It's fun, cool, and elegant; It can be dressed up or down based on your style or the event you choose to wear it to. Throw on a white tee, jeans, and this jacket, BAM, you're going to brunch, it can be a great work garment, I can totally see this w/ some pinstripes... etc. And yes, the jacket does run a bit big, but it's supposed to be oversized. Order a size down if that's something that would bothersome to you. Me personally? I loved that, it allowed me to comfortably roll up, and push up the sleeves; Which I am all about. Oh and the jacket's bit long, so if you're on the shorter side it might make your proportions look a bit off, it was about mid-thigh--maybe lower-- on me.
Loved the oversized look and length of this. I would have kept longer but I have more clothes to try! I wore this with black skinny jeans and heels one night, sneakers the next.

This jacket is so beautifully simple in style but rich and textural in material. There is a whisper of metallic throughout. I loved the subtle padding in the shoulders; the fit in in the chest and shoulders was spot on for me. I also loved the lengthy but fitted silhouette for my short stature, and paired it with some structured high waisted culottes. Super elegant and fun, too!

links_reviews_title: Rented for work and to dress up a t-shirt and pair of jeans.
links_reviews_text: Really oversized. Loved the fabric, pattern and quality but returned it because it swallowed me up. I'm 5'4" and it looked like I was playing dress up. I'm hoping a smaller size will work.
This jacket is HUGE. I wear a size 8/10 and ordered a medium. It felt large, but almost too big to the point where it just felt a bit overwhelming.
Very oversized even in a small, but I guess that's the style! Pretty for dressing up an outfit.
I know this jacket is meant to be oversized, but at 5 months pregnant it was swimming on me. I felt like a little kid playing dress up
Blazer fit true to size. Fitted in the shoulders but offers the oversized/boxy look everywhere else. The pattern was louder than I expected but still cute.

links_reviews_title: Rented it for everyday or for work. Does not suit me at all.
links_reviews_text: This jacket is really long, even though I am 5'7''. It looks very weird, but the material is fine. Had to return it..:(

I lived this blazer! It was long and kind of oversized but still fitted. I got compliments on it at work and also wore it on a date. I will rent it again! My only complaint was that one lapel kept folding over, but that may have just been an issue with the specific one I received.

I got this in today I put it on to try it on and it is so large it goes down past my knees and it sits out so much that I could've fit another person in it it was nothing like the picture and I got a small. Mind you I have a larger chest and even with that it wasn't touching this I didn't even wear it and returned it back immediately.
I really wanted to like this statement piece, but it was stiff and boxy. Nice fit in the shoulders but was a cross between an A line and an over sized blazer. Didn't work for me.
This was a super cool blazer. It paired so nicely with a black turtleneck and black jeans. Could definitely dress up or dress down. It seems large, but I think that's just the style.

I read that this was oversized, but on me that was an understatement. I'm a true size 14, but I was absolutely swimming in the XL. My 10 year old laughed when I tried it on and she and I both fit in it with the jacket closed in front of us. It was beautiful and very well made. I'll rent again but I'll definitely size down.
It's too oversized. I couldn't use. The fit is weird.
This is so awesome! It's comfy and flattering and very forgiving in the wrinkle department.

This is without a double the most comfortable jumpsuit I've ever worn. It's stylish and easy and totally perfect for travel. Easy to put on and take off (yes, even bathroom breaks were seamless). I love this jumpsuit and I'm seriously thinking of just buying.
A little baggie fit I had to wear fashion tape in order to keep the top closed. So even though it was really big on me I still wore a bunch !
Fit well though the top was a little low cut for work. Major plus easy to get off to use the bathroom

This was such a cute and airy jumpsuit! I got loads of compliments when I wore this in Milan over spring break and at work when I came home! The button covering the chest does pop open a bit easily so if you have a larger chest be careful!!

i wore this to work and then also to travel to Vegas on the plane. I had been wanting to rent for awhile but the xs has never become available. It probably would have fit more snuggly. NOTE: the tie belt is only on the front of the jumpsuit - does not go all the way around or pull around so it is a little hard to make the waist look slim/defined. The general look was really nice and can be styled up or down.
Fit great. The fabric is nice.

links_reviews_title: Extremely comfortable, I was able to wear this all day in humid, hot VA.
links_reviews_text: Light, airy, bra not necessary, soft and fits perfectly.
Great quality. Wore it for a brunch out with the girls. Loved it!

I love this seersucker jumpsuit to work despite how wrinkled it was when it arrived. Got multiple compliments at the office -- people love a romper. Great lightweight fabric for a 100 degrees summer day but has no stretch or give; harder to get on and off. Wish there was a way to prevent the wrinkles.
Great for work in the summer

This fabric is so light and breathable, the seersucker is perfect for the summer. I found it did get rumpled after a while day's wearing, though. (Pic is of me after 12 hours.) I had to pin the front between the waist and neckline as it was loose on me and gapped a little. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Many many complements, very comfortable. pockets !!! gimme more pockets !! always
links_reviews_text: light and airy, pair w tan sandals

links_reviews_title: Easy, fun, and I'm buying it immediately.
links_reviews_text: Love this romper so much. It looks great, fits perfect, and is easy to dress down or up depending on where you want to wear it. I paired it with a pair of black Steve Madden flats but you could easily wear chunky sandals or heels to give it a new look. Seriously the best.

I loved this jumpsuit so much, I wore two weekends in a row!!! I honestly wish I could keep it (maybe I'll buy it later on). I wore this to brunch with some friends one weekend and then the next weekend I wore it to the Lauryn Hill concert. I love the material and how light weight it is. It's easy to take on and off with the snap closures and zippers. I love the little details of the ties in front and on the sleeves. I got a lot of compliments from my friends. Just a really easy outfit that can be dressed up or down. Based on others reviews, I ordered the small (when I usually wear a medium and jumpsuits) and it fit perfectly. I would have been swimming in a larger size. Overall, a great piece to rent for any weekend activities.
I took this on a trip to Italy and felt comfortable and elegant! Cleavage was a bit low, but felt fine when worn with a cami

links_reviews_title: Love! Easy to look put together!
links_reviews_text: Surprised how comfortable and yet stylish this is. Wish I had rented sooner. Definitely will try to get one or two more wears.
Fit great. Didnt spill out on top. Loved it and got tons of compliments.

I did think this was a very nice jumpsuit that's great for warm weather. I did find it to be too baggy in the top and ultimately I had to tie the belt behind my back so it would fit my waist properly. The belt does not have a lot of adjustable room and therefore isn't perfect on a person with an hourglass figure. Also kind of looks like pajamas but I'm here for that.

Because I am long waisted, I ordered a size 6, but it swam on me in the waist. The belt assisted with this but overall I didn't find this to be super flattering. The top gapes a little so I also wore a camisole. Belt plus it being a jumpsuit meant it was a pain to use the restroom.

Loved this jumpsuit! It was so comfortable and a light fabric, classy yet comfortable. You could easily dress this up or down. I loved that it was fairly easy to take on and off (because you know, jumpsuits are notoriously difficult when you need to use the restroom). This has the stamp of approval!

I wore this to a social networking event (local fashion show) and I felt adequate and comfortable. This fit true to size, but model on the picture must have long legs because I'm 5'-5" and it was way longer than on her. Not a complain. Just a fact. I loved this choice!

Ran a little big, but I think that was the style honestly. It zipped up and buttoned perfectly, but the top felt a little loose. Other then that, it was perfect. I looked so stylish, but super professional. I paired it with a bandeau to stop any cleavage slips in the office and it worked super well.
Very cute jumpsuit. mine was a little too large, therefore plunged too deep in the front. Would order again but a smaller size.
I took a gamble ordering a MR since it was the only size available and it didn't pay off. However the fabric was really nice and comfy and the cut is flattering if you order it in the right size!

I really like this romper, but it was right in the waistline. The rest of the fit was good, but I was moderately uncomfortable throughout the day due to the tight waist. So, unless you have a small waist at size 16, the XL may be uncomfortable.

Really loved this but the top isn't completely closed. It's just a button at the top and waist. The fabric is just overlapping on the top. Not completely closed. You need a top underneath which is a dealbreaker for me
Casual fit and fabric type. It's a bit floppy but that made it comfy and not too precious to wear around my kids on Saturday.
Easy to throw on. Washable. Seersucker cute for summer.

links_reviews_title: Cute and comfortable! Especially for 5'9" with long torso!
links_reviews_text: This was so cute and easy, and totally comfortable. I am tall and long-waisted and jumpsuits hardly ever fit. This one was so comfortable I will probably wear it on the plane on a trip overseas. I did find the fly to be troublesome - it folds open even when zipped - but I used some fashion tape to keep it closed. I will have a snap put in since I like this so much I bought it.
It is a nice lightweight jumpsuit, but it is lower cut so may need to wear with a camisole.

links_reviews_title: I wore this for a day at the office.
links_reviews_text: This is cute. It has snaps to close the V-neck, and snaps at the waist. These immediately pulled open. I ended up wearing a camisole underneath, and then cinching the belt pretty tightly. Was fun to wear for a day but buttons in lieu of the snaps would have felt / been much more secure.
Fun, casual style. It ran very small though so I didn't wear.
It was the perfect outfit for brunch.
Did not wear. Didn't fit me but I wish it did !
Fits well, but if it was any shorter in the torso it wouldn't have worked. I wore a cami under it.
Could not fasten across my chest, when I tried it immediately popped open again

links_reviews_title: Cute but was a little big for me
links_reviews_text: I really liked the pattern and how some of the jumpsuit fit. I'm always hesitant to wear rompers/jumpsuits because of my height & body type but this was a good option. My only complaint is that the chest/neckline and waist area ran large. I had to wear a bralette to cover some cleavage & a deeper V than what's appropriate for work and other reviews also mentioned this but the belt does not loop around your waist- wish it did so you could make it tighter!
Couldn't even finish trying it on...thank you NEXT
So cute that I bought it! Wore a cami underneath because it gapped. Very cool and comfortable and stylish

links_reviews_title: Understated elegance in luxe black knit
links_reviews_text: I like that the dress was in two parts. Sleek mermaid cut with beautiful detail in the knit. Loved the top with sleeves, a touch of casual. Not a fussy dress but very easy to wear.
