The top is very cropped but looks cute with high waist jeans, the fabric is the same as the Herve Leger dresses so nice and thick. It was cute, but it just didn't end up working for what I intended (College Darty lol)
Too short for me, otherwise the material was thick and good quality
The sweater was just as expected. I sized up to a medium for longer sleeves. I didn't have to wear high waisted jeans (in photo) but would have been a better choice.
Loved this style but couldn't make the crop top work

This sweater is everything I had hoped for based on the photo and more. From the colors to the fit to the fabric, it's truly perfect. It's lightweight and a great transition piece. I wear a S or M in tops depending on the brand and the M in this is great because it's more of a slim/tailored fit.
I knew it was cropped but I am very short waisted so thought I could pull it off. Nope. Must be ridiculous on normal waisted people.
I love the cropped look and the block colors. I will wear this a few more times before returning. I received several compliments.
Wore this to lounge around on a Saturday in the fall- got lots of compliments even though it's a simple design. Knit is very lightweight

hits exactly where it needs to hit and the fabric is light but substantial. the second i put it on i checked to see how much it would be to buy it because i could easily see it becoming a wardrobe staple. alas, still too expensive but will definitely rent again!
Perfect little bag! Went w everything!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful bag and bigger than expected!
links_reviews_text: Loved this bag and it easily fit phone, wallet, and accessories.
Cozy winter work dress! The black detail makes it more fun.

links_reviews_title: Boyfriend and I went to a fancy restaurant. Fabulous food. He said the L word for the 1st time :)
links_reviews_text: Asymmetry is cool but you wonder if that's the way it's supposed to fit. Looked cute but low cut by bust so had to wear something under
True to size, nothing special. Cute for work but not a showstopper.

I wore this dress for a night out while I was out of town with my best friend. I felt sexy and I really liked this dress. It was a little shorter than I usually wear and the material was quite thin, but it wasn't sheer or see-through. It worked well in the Florida heat.

links_reviews_title: So cute I had to keep it!
links_reviews_text: This dress was the perfect mix of chic and affordable. I ended up keeping it because I loved it so much. I was complimented multiple times throughout the day! I did have to put a black cami underneath it because the wrap section was too low-cut, so keep that in mind. Then I took the cami off for after work drinks! Fit was just right. Highly recommend.
Fit pretty well, a little awkward with the asymmetry
The only con is the slit is really high and flies up easily. I used a little bit of fashion tape and it stayed in place

This dress was initially a back up, I wasn’t sure because of other reviews if it would look too casual/like club wear to be suitable for my husband’s work party. I ended up loving it so much I spent part of the night googling where to buy it! The material lightweight but a dressier step up from cotton I did wear a tank and shorts under to give more coverage.
The fabric is then, so I would wear this with a jacket and/or leggings for fall. Otherwise great for a casual every day look with booties in a structured bag.

links_reviews_title: Pretty from the front but the butt is too tight
links_reviews_text: Liked this for the most part - great fit up top, nice loose sleeves, v neck wasn't too deep at all for work, looks great from the front. Cons: - a tiny bit short (I planned to wear with leggings anyway, but definitely wouldn't wear to work without ") - biggest one: too right in the butt area, and I have a pretty flat butt so that's surprising. Underwear line was showing too. Compensated by wearing a long vest over it at work. If I had sized up the top would have been too loose.
The front of this dress is so flattering. The elastic band makes it comfortable and giving in the waste. The back was a little short if you have any curves but still cute!

links_reviews_title: Thin fabric, runs large; interesting shape
links_reviews_text: Pretty raspberry color. Very thin fabric and unlined so I had to layer it for winter weather in my cold part of the world. Runs large but interesting shape (I feel like it would look amazing on an hourglass figure; I felt a little droopy in it since I don't have curves). The way the slit is, it is pretty high up when you sit down (I was glad I was wearing tights).
Cant complain. Love everything about this dress!! (Warning: fabric is pretty thin so underwear-line shows )

links_reviews_title: great color but RUNS VERY LARGE
links_reviews_text: returned without wearing runs very LARGE and neckline was so low it would be impossible to wear without a cami underneath
Love this dress the fit is great I added a lacy cami under because I have a bigger bust and it is pretty low cut

links_reviews_title: Classy but fun in a great color. Runs big.
links_reviews_text: Runs large so I had to pin the waist where the wrap connected. But easy to wear, flattering and fun. Loved it.
Wore this to a Women's Only work function, completely comfy and edgy. Material is thin but perfectly good!

Lightweight and flattering style. I wore for work conferences in warm fall weather and it was comfy all day. Nice sleeve length for coverage but not too hot. I usually am between a 16-18 and hour glass shape. I tend to size up for designer dresses but will get 1X instead of 2X if I rent this again. It's a very forgiving style with plenty of room in bust and hips. I didn't even need to use the zipper so could definitely go smaller size. I had to pin the v-neck to avoid my bra showing but easy enough to fix. I'm 5'3" and length was perfectly at my knee.
Cute dress but while the bottom was fine, the top was way too large on me.

Pros: great cut, comfortable, flattering without being too revealing, lovely fall color Cons: material is much thinner than I expected (it's not lined). The length was fine on me at 5'5" with a long torso but I would have been uncomfortable sitting if it was much shorter (two bias cut pieces that make up the bottom of the faux wrap made it seem much shorter while seated).

Wore this dress to work with leggings and boots. The top is a little loose and lower cut so I wore with a tank underneath. The slit is a little high and revealing when you sit if you try to wear it without leggings.
Fabric was very thin, color is nice. Would not have worn to work if there were men in my office.

I fell in love with at the moment I tried it on fits perfectly true to size the only issue I had was sad my thighs and butt we're a little too big for the medium but my chest and shoulders were way too small for a large I ordered a medium with a back up size of a large the medium is too small or fit perfect for my butt and thighs but was rising up way too much then put on the large and it was flooding from the top

I would never be a small in anything else but this one, seriously! I love the idea of it, and I love the color and the black wrap detail.... but it's huge. Trying to pin it near the belt didn't help much, because it caused the dress to look off from behind. I wore this to work, and felt comfortable in the busy but realized the wrap detail resulted in a slit that might have been a bit more leggy than I would normally wear for work. The draping in the front is cute, as is the asymmetrical hem, but the material doesn't seem super high quality, and of course the sizing is off. I would not rent again.

My measurements are 34-29-37 / 5'2" and this dress fits okay, it has a flattering silhouette that can even make you look slimmer. The material is too thin though almost like chiffon and the stitches by the hems are a bit crumpled making it look a little cheap. I had to put in a tape to secure the breast area because it has a tendency to loosen up when seated or you would have to sit upright the whole time.

I wore XS at 7 months pregnant (to give idea how large it runs). 5'2" 120 lbs. Wore black tank under which worked well with side detail. Would recommend for those trying to hide a tummy. Would likely be large for most people who are XS.
Nice maroon color, comfortable fit, a little low in the front, good length. I wear this to work, and then transition to a wine event. Perfect for fall transition in the south.

links_reviews_title: It needs spanx. Fabric is not forgiving. But really cute on.
links_reviews_text: It was snug and short. The skirt is split under the wrap. Not a dress with a wrap like look.
Was looking for something for my birthday dinner and this wasn't sexy enough. Would be good for work though.

links_reviews_title: didn't wear it too small on the bottom part of dress, looking forward to renting in a bigger size
links_reviews_text: didn't wear it too small on the bottom part of dress
I wore this to church with a black cami and tights and alligator skin pumps. Super cute.

links_reviews_title: Fit perfectly! Not too tight and not too loose!
links_reviews_text: Wonderful color, the bust was perfect for any size. The length was also great for my height!

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable and got lots of compliments!
links_reviews_text: Fit well, covered the mid section well. The only negative is the cleavage, the top of the dress kept coming open too much when the dress would ride up.
Left side is too small and right and back are too big.

Thin fabric, flexible sizing due to the elastic panel on the side. Asymmetric hem provides visual interest but just didn't work for me. At 5'4" the length was right for me but if you're taller this would be quite short. I like the dress but could definitely size down.
Way tighter than I anticipated since most reviews said it ran big. I was uncomfortable with how clingy it was so I did not wear it. Cute dress, nothing special.

links_reviews_title: Not great for anyone with a butt.
links_reviews_text: Did not like the way it fit, easily wrinkles.

I must have received 8 compliments at work. I work with a bunch of women too so I trust em. This is different, the a symmetrical hem and black elastic. But it hugs in the right places while be work appropriate. I'm larger chested but I pinned the top a little. It's almost too unique to wear again, otherwise I'd rent this again for sure!!!
Very flattering & stylish wore to work and then drinks after
Tried the Medium, too tight in the hips. Tried the Large, was swimming in this dress. I really liked the color but the sizes didn't work for me.
Fit well- wasn't really exciting but solid and well made.
Enjoyed wearing this. The color combinations are unique. Comfortable. Great spring sweater.

Got complimented on this - it's very simple, yet the small color details make it unique. Very comfortable and soft, not itchy at all. It does run a tad large, I could have sized down...and it's a bit long which works well for me since I'm tall. It's perfect for transitioning weather, either winter to spring or summer to fall. I'll definitely rent again.

Not much to discuss here, it's a nice sweater and I was glad to try something with this neckline which I would never buy. Nice fabric, color contrast was fun and it worked well with a pair of 70s patterned pants. Was one and done for me, though.
Fitted for me since I have girls. Liked it. Only wore it once though.
Got this several sizes larger because I am so tired of short, cropped sweaters. I love them loose and comfortable and wore this one a good four times!
Wore this jeans. Probably could've sized down. Cute and comfortable
Fit true to size, but felt a little bland. Great material.
Fit well, comfortable. Could dress up or just wear on a casual day.
High quality, keeps you warm and slimming
Light, stretchy, comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Flattering, basic staple top that is very easy to pair for a work outfit!
links_reviews_text: Cute top, very easy to pair with a skirt or pants. I ended up wearing it tucked in with black pants for work and really liked it. I wasn't crazy about the color blocking on the bottom of the top (hence why I tucked it in) because it was giving too much of a 70s look that I wasn't trying to go for at work.
great fit, the details make it classy
great color, comfortable, put together. easy to dress up or down
Cute sweater top, was not overwhelmed but it is cute.
I really liked this sweater. It was comfortable and soft. The contrast of the trim wasn't as noticeable in person and I wasn't the biggest fan of the mock turtleneck. But this was still cute!
I only wore it once but it was comfortable and fit well. It wasn't particularly exciting, but it did the job.
I really liked this blouse, very comfortable fit, And matches the Bermuda shirts I rented!

links_reviews_title: It wasn't an event, it was for work.
links_reviews_text: I would have worn it more than once had it fit properly.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable and easy to wear
links_reviews_text: Its a thinner sweater material so it doesn't look bulky at all, very comfortable. I used it for work and for every day and loved it in both situations.
Lovely sweater, quality knit, traditional style with just a little touch of complimentary (but unusual) colors on sleeves and bottom. It shows your shape, but isn't tight.
runs a little small very cute, color and weight is nice for the early fall season
I should have probably rented a smaller size on this one, but I hate my clothes to be too tight. Larger in neck. Quite a few compliments though. I loved the color.

links_reviews_title: It was work. Sorry, that's forgettable.
links_reviews_text: fits long which is great over a pencil skirt or tapered pants. It was perfect.

links_reviews_title: Great sweater, perfect for spring or fall transition.
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size. I'm about 5'4", 120 lbs, 32b bust, 26 waist, 32 hips, and fits me with a little room. Probably could fit into the size 0 but then would be super snug.
Fit was okay but a bit odd. Material bunched up near my under arm pits.

I normally really like this designer and actually purchased one of their sweaters in the past but this one is blah! The colors are really murky and dark and even though I am a 38D it was weirdly loose around the bust and arms in a size large. Sent back without wearing--
I really love this shirt. It fit nicely and love the balloon sleeve details. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: love all khaite tops! HOWEVER buttons too small for holes; came undone ALL DAY.
links_reviews_text: love this top as it makes you look like a chic minimalist gibson girl. however, the buttons are too small for the holes and just come undone doing normal things.

links_reviews_title: So cute! But be sure to down 1-2 sizes.
links_reviews_text: Loved this top for work! But be sure to size down otherwise you'll be swimming in it.

links_reviews_title: Crisp well made men's shirting fabric
links_reviews_text: I thoroughly enjoyed this shirt. It was crisp and yes, crisp does wrinkle...fun mod style And the sleeves are quite long so I cuffed them in the end. Only a model looks good with only her fingertips peeking out. It is not reasonable to be able to wear a shirt like that for anything except for standing in a photo. I would say rent this if you are fashion forward. It was a fun look.
The cuffs are a bit awkward.
Definitely size down!! Great shirt, wonderful quality.
Beautiful blouse. Gorgeous details.

links_reviews_title: Cute shirt, but a bit bulky
links_reviews_text: I knew this would have an oversized look, but as other reviewers had said, it is quite big and I wish an XS was available! The sleeves have a unique cut, making this an interesting alternative to your basic button down and the color is springy and fresh. I didnt wear as it didnt do much for my figure, but I liked the "concept" of the shirt!
Fits very loose. Loved the oversized sleeves. Hint: sleeves are long, so I rolled up the cuffs and looked so cool and chic.

I wore it and really wanted to like it but - it's one of those fabrics that gets incredibly wrinkled quick, which makes it look disheveled and dirty. Coupled with it not being a fitting shirt - it was hard to like.
Crisp, cute and perfect fit. Very polished work shirt. I received so many compliments. Will rent again.

links_reviews_title: This is the best button up ever
links_reviews_text: The fit was perfect for an oversized sleeve while still keeping a fitted waist. The buttons also had fabric so it felt extra detailed and the collar is the best collar ever. So crisp! If it wasn't a $500 shirt, I would keep it in a heartbeat!

links_reviews_title: Pale blue (not white) shirt with very long sleeves
links_reviews_text: Beautiful material with covered buttons. The sleeves' cuffs are 6 inches and very stiff. Sleeves are too long and "rolling" them up was neither easy nor a good look. Had to iron the shirt as the length and puffiness of the sleeves means it does not survive the shipping wrinkle-free. Wore once to work and then returned.
This was a very nice shirt for work. Fit was fine and the sleeves are quite balloon-y. But this gave it some edge and sophistication at the same time.
Too big, not flattering in the arms/shoulders.

This shirt is literally a size 2 XL on me. Huge, horrible, wrinkly. The sleeves are extremely long and unflattering (and I have long arms!). I do not recommend. This might be the ugliest shirt I've ever tried on and it fits nothing like shown in the pictures. The only pro is it's a nice cotton material.

Aside from not having the matching belt sent with my pants, I loved this look (that's why I gave 4 stars). The pants fit perfectly and the paper sack waist so charming. I paired it with a black turtleneck and pumps and felt confident and chic all at the same time. I would definitely rent these again!!

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, stylish, and fun paper bag pants
links_reviews_text: These were so comfortable and fun! I loved the look on me. I have a small waist and big hips and they were a great fit for me, especially with the tie at the waist where I could adjust the fit as needed. The ruffle at the waist was very cute. The only thing that I thought was strange was the tag - it's on the ruffle/waist portion so it definitely shows. I had a blazer on most of the day so you couldn't see it, but I don't think they thought that one through...

Love these pants so much I rented them 3 times before finally buying them. I always get so many compliments when I wear them and they are sooo comfortable! I think they are flattering and waist-accentuating.

These are adorable, but also...ridiculous. I'm usually between a 6 and an 8 in pants (27" waist, 37" hips), and I was SWIMMING in this 6. I'm a 5'8 woman in my 30s and I looked like a little turn-of-the-century urchin trying to hobble after a train. Cinching the waist didn't help, since there was so much fabric poofing around the hips and lower belly. (My only photo is a bit blurry, so I'm not sure it gets this across, but trust me.) Sizing down might help, but I expect that would make the rise shorter, and for my long torso that's not workable either. For a Halloween costume they'd be adorable -- for trying to look like an adult at work, they weren't exactly what I wanted.
Great pants, perfect for summer because very lightweight. I would consider getting a size up if you have a shorter torso so you can wear them lower on your waist. I plan on wearing these a bunch!

links_reviews_title: Cute and comfortable but runs very large
links_reviews_text: These pants are comfortable and easy to wear. I'm tall and didn't have an issue with the inseam, which is often an issue for me. Definitely size down at least one size, these were swimming on me and stretched out some throughout the day. They bagged a little it the front, but this could be helped with a smaller size.

links_reviews_title: Love these pants. Professional and fun
links_reviews_text: I am usually between 6 and 8, based on other reviews went for a 6 and it's just right. Very very comfortable and still flattering with a more fitted top, one of those wardrobe jackpots. Nice fabric. I would rent again for work
Super easy to dress up for work or around town for errands. Love them and will be repeating soon. The fabric is a really nice light cotton (?) and worked well for the rainy, slightly cold NY spring.

links_reviews_title: Statement pant good for work or casual day!
links_reviews_text: The pants are so chic, yet comfortable! I've rented these before and couldn't resist.

Absolutely runs big. I usually wear an 8, sometimes a 6 and could have absolutely worn a 4. But they are intended to be oversized. Of course, bring 5'2" they are longer than I would prefer but it worked and they were so comfortable and I received lots of compliments.

Took the feedback advice and ordered a size down and the 10 fit perfectly! Paired with a black sleeveless turtleneck, multiple pearl strands, and a black bolero blazer. Shoes added a pop of color. Perfect for work and a fun night out afterwards.
These pants were super comfortable and the fit was right on. I have a long torso and felt like the paper bag waist came up surprisingly high so if you have a short torso I would rent with caution.
I wore these to a meeting in Shanghai and received a lot of compliments. They're cute and comfortable, but a little on the large side. I'd rent these again but probably size down.
These were so dope I would have kept them except they were shipped without the belt. Will definitely buy.

links_reviews_title: Cute but a little over sized and made me look short
links_reviews_text: The material was great and soft. I loved the textured appearance of the grey. The cut and style was super cute. But it's not the best fit for a pear shaped body. It just makes your bottom half looked bigger than it already is. I also have a long torso and short legs (typical Asian top to bottom ratio), and the Capri cut made my legs look even shorter. I should've known it would do that, but they were so comfy and cute, I just had to wear them at least once.
They do run big I could have done a 4/6 where I normally am a 6/8. Super cute. Styled with booties and a black turtleneck. Several compliments from folks
These pants are the cutest! Probably will need to size down. They definitely don't do anything for your butt, but I got so many compliments when I wore them!
Runs a little large you can get away with sizing down. Received a lot of compliments. Loved the pants for work.
Fit is very large. I'm normally a 16 and the 14 was big on me. Fun pants to wear. Not particularly flattering for the pear shapes like me, but got compliments because they are unique.

These pants are super cute and add variety to your ward robe. They are a little bit difficult to match with a top, and I think a button down or V-neck looks best. They do run large. I am a very standard 4, and the 2 fit perfectly.
I really like the idea of these pants but the legs were huge. I wanted the waist to stand up better like the picture but was floppy. Fine for one time wear but wouldn't wear again.

I loved these so much I had to buy them. I wore them twice to work before deciding to take the plunge and I just had to have them. They're comfortable and stylish, work great with my long long legs and itty bitty waist. They even make me look like I have hips I don't really have. Posted this photo on social media and got great feedback from friends.

links_reviews_title: Get a size or two smaller
links_reviews_text: The pants are great but run at least one size up.

These definitely run a bit big. I'm athletic build and usually vary Btwn a 6-8 in pants but I needed to size down in these. They didn't look bad but a smaller size would have been better. They were just a little more baggy in the legs and the butt than I would have liked. Still got a ton of compliments on the style, though!

These pants were very outside of my comfort zone.. and I considered not wearing them because the butt hangs a little weird.. but multiple people chased me down to tell me how much they loved them. Zipper was broken so it was a little tricky, but overall I was happy with the rental.

Wore these unique pants to work followed by a wine and paint party. It was the perfect blend of office appropriate and fun. Got so many compliments. The waistband is creative - loved it. These pants are supposed to be baggy, still I thought it ran large so I sized down to 4. I'm normally a 6 in the waist. I'd rent this again!

I LOVED these pants but they are oversized. I recommend sizing down. The tags were attached which was awesome. Overall the fit was comfortable and as expected - slightly ankle length (I'm 5'7) and true to size everywhere else. I had room in the waist which typically isnt the case for me so I would recommend that others go down a size if you want a more snug look. Loved!

These paper bag waist pants are super cute! Just enough detail to be interesting, but still work-appropriate. Styled with a solid knit top and flats for the office. These were so comfortable and fit TTS.

links_reviews_title: Definitely size down - Love these pants!
links_reviews_text: I usually am between a 2 and 4 for pants (2 in Theory, 4 in most other brands), but followed others' advice for these pants and sized down to a 0 and did not regret. Anything larger would have been too big. These pants are super cute and comfy, with enough pizzazz to look unique and stylish but not too crazy to wear to work!

I'm 5'6" with a 26 waist and 34.5/35 hip and these pants are like clown pants on me in a 0. If you have small hips or a small tushy like I do, they may not be the best pant for you unless there is a 00, which I didn't see.
I wanted to like these but they were SO BIG! Should have gone two sizes below normal.

links_reviews_title: Cute - but busy at the top
links_reviews_text: The pants fit well and were really nice, good quality fabric. But there was so much fabric and bunching at the top, that it felt a bit much. And with the added belt, it was too much. Only wore once.
Loved the style of the pants and would've definitely sized down if I would've read the reviews more carefully. Still wore it and loved the lewk!

links_reviews_title: Trendy but you need to be tall to wear these
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'2" and couldn't quite pull these off. They are cute in concept but I think you need to be tall to wear theses.
I sized up based on reviews - mistake! Had to send back these super cute pants. Fabric was great, style was chic. Pity
Very cute and fashionable pants, the waist sat beautifully and the belt didn't move much although i was on the move the entire day. Highly recommended!
Pros: Versatile color, fun details, comfortable and well made Cons: Waist above the belt was high but very floppy

I wore this to work with a black top and black 1 inch heels. I felt very sophisticated and really enjoyed the outfit. The belt was my favorite part. It's a little frumpy up top so keep that in mind. I went back and forth between purchasing and returning, but ended up returning after my month of renting was over.

You should most definitely size down and I never have to do that with pants. Even with sizing down they were still a bit too big. However, these are super cute pants. I love the "touch of flair" to a gray trouser.

links_reviews_title: Style was very adorable but the fit is incredibly oversized.
links_reviews_text: I typically prefer my clothing less fitted, but this style in my usual, slightly oversized 10 was so big in the waist and through the legs. Even with the belt you I had too much trouble keeping the pants in place. I'd recommend sizing one or two sizes down depending on how you prefer fit.

links_reviews_title: WFH - great color and great stretch
links_reviews_text: Dress does not have a zipper but has enough stretch. Great purple
Runs large. Go one size down. High quality material. Power dress. Classy, classic, timeless. Amazing color.

This dress fits like a million bucks. Thick scuba material so hugs the curves and no zipper so must go over shoulders. But has good stretch. Once on very forgiving around hips and tummy. Great lines. If I had to pick a con: conforms a little tight around the knees so can be difficult to take wide strides.

I wore this for a work conference and it stuck out- in a good way! In a sea of black skirts and blazers, this dress will catch an eye! It was very comfortable. I recommend wearing spanx with it and be weary of deodorant. If you get just a hint of it on the dress, it will not come off!!!
This fit true to size. The details are nice. The only thing was that this has no zippers and the dress is fitted, so had some minor underwear shifting issue when I would go to the bathroom.
I love La Petite chiara boni dresses. The material is such high quality! The bright cobalt blue is striking.

links_reviews_title: Vibrant, flattering, and way too gorgeous for my work, but will rent again!
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress as much as I have the designer's other creations, however it's almost too gorgeous and rich for daytime. Would love to wear to a professional event in the evening. My family voted it was not quite right for the presentation or interview I had planned. Will try it again someday!
This dress is amazing! The fabric is of such high quality and the details are perfect. This has been my favorite work dress rental yet!

links_reviews_title: I wore this dress on stage in front of 12,000 people and it made me look and feel like a #ladyboss.
links_reviews_text: It's tight, and has no zipper, so it was a bit of an adventure to get on and off, but if you have a lean build, this dress is smokin' hot. The fabric is thicker than you'd think, so it is a bit forgiving, which was awesome. I didn't even wear spanx, but mostly because I was nervous about a line being visible. Gorgeous dress. A million compliments. I would buy this if given the opportunity.

links_reviews_title: Camera ready confidence- Chiara Boni La Petite Robe for the win!
links_reviews_text: The fit was very flattering and heads were turning the moment I put it on. I was happy to be able to skip it on not worry about any bumps, bulges or rolls showing through. Great dress!!

links_reviews_title: Stunning color, not for blending in
links_reviews_text: This dress is a show- stopper!! If you are feeling shy or need to just blend in, avoid! It is made of rather thick " scuba" material, which is good BUT it fit a bit loose around the tummy, so I almost didn't wear it because it did make me look a little " poochy", The color and the style won me over and I had a night filled with fun and compliments... I am a size 6/8, and I would suggest going with a larger size if you are curvy!! This dress is a definite confidence booster!!!
Very comfortable and flattering.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous fit and color, stretchy, but hid my little tummy well despite there was no zipper
links_reviews_text: No zipper, stretchy fit, but in all the right places if you have an athletic build with a little tummy

It's a struggle to slither into (no zipper!) but it's so worth it. Great structure and rich color. *Really* form-fitting; choose—or forgo—undergarments accordingly. Since it's longer and quite tight, short strides are necessary.

links_reviews_title: I felt fabulous in this dress
links_reviews_text: The dress fits well and the thick stretchy material is very forgiving, yet form fitting. I loved how skinny I felt in it and my backside looked great I must say! Be warned, there is no zipper so you have to slide into the dress over your head. This means makeup, hair and deodorant should all be done AFTER the dress goes on. The material does pick up and show stuff easily, such as powder and lotion. However, I found it totally worth it and would rent again!
Biggest con is that there is no zipper and it's a squeeze to pull overhead, but once on it's a spandex-y material that flattered. LOTS of compliments!

The dress fit perfectly once I finally got it on, though I didn't end up wearing it, since it was a little to dressy for my event. I found it extremely difficult to get out of this dress. And putting it on was not easy either--no zippers.

As a tall hourglass, this brand is my go-to for both quality and fit. The fabric is an hourglass' dream as it hugs curves beautifully! I'm a solid 46 and never have had fit issues with this brand -Until this dress! I didn't even bother trying it on when it arrived and rented for a meeting/presentation later in the week. Oh no! The mid-section of this dress was HUGE with giant gaping waist! Ugh...had to find something else to wear.

This dress was beautiful and I had planned to wear it for engagement photos. Unfortunately, the length of the dress was awkward for me (hit more at mid-calf than just below the knee). The fabric is super comfortable and the color is beautiful in person.
No zipper ... get ready to shimmy into this one. Great fabric, gorgeous color, but a smidge too dressy for work. Awesome for cocktails

links_reviews_title: Wore this to a work event
links_reviews_text: It's tough to squeeze into but once it's on it fits like a dream. The color is a cross between royal blue and purple. It's a stunning look.

This designer runs small for me. I'm usually a 4 across the board (and a small 34A), but always wear a 42 with this line. So comfortable and stretchy! Pull the dress down over your head, don't try to pull it up because I nearly ripped the shoulder seams doing that. Lots of compliments in my office building, even from strangers in the elevator. Beautiful blue color!

Great fit, dress is very stretchy so it hugs your body. It's a little annoying to put on and take off because it has no zipper but once it's on it's a very comfortable dress. Received lots of compliments. True to size
Fit perfectly

This dress fits beautifully, the color is so vibrant and attention grabbing while still classy. I love this brand and this is the third dress that I've rented from them. It was slightly long coming down to my mid calf but with heels it looked as though it was supposed to be that way. I love that the fit stays all day and doesn't stretch out. I would rent the dress again.
Great color , cut is interesting and asymmetrical. Statement piece without going over the top.
Needs a zipper
Once you get the dress on it's pretty, but it's so hard to get on . It's made out of stretchy material, but there isn't a zipper so it's a tight fit.

links_reviews_title: Didn't wear it. It was too "fancy" for work.
links_reviews_text: Would rent for a special event but not work.
This was a very nice dress for work.
Multiple compliments. Great material. Perfect fit. Very comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Fits in all the right places
links_reviews_text: Dress is a work out to get in and out of it. Put it on before make up and take make up off before removing it. Otherwise once it's on it hugs all the right places. Stays in place all day and does look tired by 7pm. Fun lines. Will definitely rent again
This dress is stunning. Fits well and is extremely flattering. Tough to get on as there is no zipper but fits like a glove once it is on. Highly recommend!

links_reviews_title: I LOVE this dress. Elegant, gorgeous color and fits like a glove. I want to own it! very comfortable
links_reviews_text: It pulls over the head, no zipper, but it’s very comfortable and looks dressy. Very flattering

The color is simply stunning, the front panel lays perfectly and can be adjusted. I'm 5'8" and it was below my knees. It is long which was perfect however if you are on the petite side it is something to consider.
Tight and comfortable. Would buy instantly if I had the money.
Great fit

links_reviews_title: There is not a zipper to put the dress on and take it off.
links_reviews_text: Very flattering!
Sooo many compliments and the fit was and always is AMAZING. The ONLY drawback is no zipper makes me feel like I need to dislocate my shoulders each time I put it on and off over my head

This is a great, cozy piece for colder months. The fabric was thicker than expected, which kept me warm and gave the fabric a nice draping effect. My only complaints were that it is a little difficult to put a jacket on over the top, and it shipped without the drawstring which I think would have made it even cuter.
In love with this cape sweater. It's lightweight but warm, and the fabric is so nice but cozy. Feels like cashmere. Can dress up or dress down. Love it!

links_reviews_title: It's soft and comfortable just darker then I expected.
links_reviews_text: Very soft and comfortable. Has a big "wing" expansion when you use your arms. The color is darker then I expected, more of a charcoal gray.

links_reviews_title: So comfy and cute. I got a lot of compliments!
links_reviews_text: It’s so so comfy and I definitely recommend this item and would order this again.

Loved this! Would have easily purchased it, and have definitely considered renting it again. Very comfortable, and cute for on the weekends. Didn't come with the drawstring though, which was the only reason I did not buy it.
Walked all over Zürich on a crisp, fall day and it was the perfect layering piece. Warm enough, arms are covered (prefer this in a poncho) but roomy to be able to move easily. Soft fabric.
Super comfortable and so cute! Wore to travel in and it was so cozy on the plane.
Without even realizing it, I rented this top for a second time. It's super comfy. I wear a cami under it, though I don't think you'd have to.
Nothing special. I wasn't a fan of the wings coming to the wrist. If it ended at my elbows I would have liked it more.

links_reviews_title: So comfortable and easy to wear. Perfect for a ball game that's chilly or just a day ha hanging out.
links_reviews_text: Perfect fit for flowy fun.

I wasn't sure about the shirt at first, but it grew on me. Cute cut and interesting seams on the front that were slightly slimming. The long "wings" did get in the way at times, but not too bad. A good in-between season too as it wasn't too warm. The color is a bit off from what I'd want and the fabric seemed a bit worn, otherwise I might have purchased.
Picture looked like it had sleeves but it doesn't
Good material and comfortable, but a darker grey than the image and more oversized than expected. I also thought this had a hood but it does not.
I really liked this piece for everyday wear - so cute, comfy, and cozy. Best for a chilly day when you don't need a jacket, because I'm not sure how a jacket would work over the poncho.

links_reviews_title: Comfy and Cute... just not functional'
links_reviews_text: The material was soft, but the sleeves kept getting g in my way. When I washed my hands, the sleeves got wet.... hmm. I ended up talking it off mid day.
This one is for comfort, above all. Also, it's one size fits all, but the cut was nevertheless kind of flattering - it drapes well. Almost looks more like a cape than a poncho (in my opinion).
Pocket at the front doesn't quite sit right on my new bump, but otherwise this is super cosy.. fairly thin material but hangs well.. would buy for sure if it was slightly cheaper

I wore this both casually with leggings for a day at home and to work with dress pants for a casual day at the office. It is very warm and cozy, but it is a bit clunky with the arms being so wide, it's almost like having wings. Cute and warm for casual winter days though!

I wore this twice, for work and for friends. It's definitely more casual, so I don't know if every workplace would be cool with it, but for mine it was perfect. I usually wear a 12ish, and this fit me perfectly. It was SO COZY. Like, in danger of falling asleep at my desk cozy. I can't say it did much for my shape, but then, if you wanted something to enhance curves, you're probably not looking at a poncho anyway. It definitely was 'cool' looking though, I got a ton of compliments.
Fit really well and despite being a big poncho it was well designed and at no point was I at risk of flashing anybody by accident. The material was so soft and comfortable, and very warm.
Super soft and comfortable without looking sloppy
The sweater itself was super cute but it shed on EVERYTHING. There will be fuzz on everything around you.

Wore this to an interview recently and since I'm busty, i put a black cami underneath. Fit great just probs wouldn't feel comfy to wear this to work everyday due to my cleavage. Garment is made well and lined.

Fit true to size and the color is gorgeous. Wore it to a Christmas party and got tons of compliments! Figure flattering, especially for those with large busts. The bottom is more of a sheath dress fit, so if you like things loose around the stomach I would size up. I wish the wrap tie was a bit longer, slightly awkward to tie. But overall loved it, would rent again for a winter event. J

Pros- comfy, stretchy, nice emerald color (pretty dark, but I like it). Easy to style. Looked nice with a circle scarf and boots. Good fit on length, arms, shoulders. Cons- sort of sticks out from the hips due to fabric not laying flat in that area (I am a pear but long waisted). Same size as I normally wear for this designer but prefer other styles due to this small issue. I still wore it to work and it wasn't a big deal.

Elegant dress Super comfortable nice stretch Fits true to size - came to my knee at 5'6 Winter green appears darker in pic. Was a little low but nothing that a safety pin couldn't tackle. Wasn't too thick good for fall temps

This dress is comfortable and highlights the right areas. The v neck can be adjusted a bit to control the cleavage level. The length of the dress makes it classy, could be worn to work. Size down- runs large.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable dress that looked nice for an evening work event.
links_reviews_text: Was very comfortable, I got a lot of compliments especially for the forest green color. The fabric hugs every curve...so control top hose was REQUIRED for me. I didn't love it enough to buy it but felt great in the dress.

links_reviews_title: Wore this dress to the ballet one evening. It fit perfectly!
Received a lot of compliments, very form fitting and comfortable.
links_reviews_text: Pros: great color and love the mesh around the waist Con: a bit low cut
I felt a little old in this dress and it was really heavy.

links_reviews_title: Great dress to wear to work!
links_reviews_text: Great dress! I'm still working to hide my post pregnancy stomach and this dress was wonderful. The color is wonderful and the warmth level is perfect for winter. Only complaint is that it is a little low cut so I wore a slip underneath.
Great flattering fit, easy faux wrap. Love the green color.

links_reviews_title: I got so many compliments on how I looked in the dress. Everyone loved the color.
links_reviews_text: Perfect fit. The material layed very well. Comfortable and figure flattering.
Fit well and was flattering without being too revealing. I wore to work without a tank top. The fabric is heavy, so it feels a bit stretched by the end of the day

links_reviews_title: Awesome work dinner with colleagues visiting from out of town.
links_reviews_text: Fit like a dream - very comfortable and flattering.

links_reviews_title: Flattering fit, great for the office
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress to a meeting where I met new colleagues for the first time. I felt comfortable wearing it and received complements. Makes a great first impression.
Had to use beauty tape at the neckline to keep from being too low cut and showing my bra. Nice jersey material, lined. True to size.

This dress is just blah. Nothing special all though the fabric is heavy, so certainly a good winter dress. I found the middle section to be a bit weird and sits weird at the back as well. Sent back without wearing.
Fits well but a little short but I will wear dark hose
Nice color, hugs in right places only

links_reviews_title: This dress is so comfortable and sophisticated
links_reviews_text: Stretchy, not too low cut, comfortable, pretty color
Ordered size up as a result no pulling fit was good. Wasn't crazy about the color but the right accessories could spice it up.

No cons about this dress from me. It's a perfect dress for the colder months, as the material is a bit thick. The color is similar to an emerald green. It's absolutely stunning. No issues about the breast portion being to large, which is something I often struggle with having small breasts. It's a stunning dress! I'd rent it again.
fits true to size and is very flattering. The dress is lined and made of a sturdy, but stretchy fabric. Super chic and comfy for work. Only downside is that it is slightly low cut.

links_reviews_title: This is a great work dress, comfortable, flowy, and in a great color!
links_reviews_text: I really liked this dress for work, my main issue was it was too long for me. I am 5'4" and the dress went over my knees making it look frumpy. Otherwise, the wrap aspect on the bodice was very slimming and the v-neck was very tasteful. I would recommend this for someone a little taller.
Great fit. Loved the color. Liked the snap that kept the front from coming apart. However, the shirt was probably a little worn, as the snap showed.

links_reviews_title: Great color but a bit revealing
links_reviews_text: This is a beautiful blouse. I love the color and the slightly poofed sleeves. I originally got it for work but wore it on a date night instead. Like many wrap tops, I had a difficult time adequately covering the cleavage. The snap was in an awkward spot for me so I used a safety pin instead. I am not that bossomy...36D on a 5'10 frame.

links_reviews_title: Great color and great piece. Fit exactly how it imagined it would.
links_reviews_text: Was the perfect top for a night out with my fiancé. The color popped, and it showed some cleavage (I'm a 34D so I couldn't button it). Received tons of compliments and my man loved it as well. Would recommend!

This had some negative reviews but decided to give it a try anyway. Honestly, best decision. It’s beautiful and flattering. Wore for an outfit change for my engagement shoot and it was such a beautiful red. Highly recommend. Wish I could have kept it!

links_reviews_title: Loved the color, be aware of opening
links_reviews_text: Fit great. Had adjustable button inside that helped give it a a tailored look. However, the snap wasn't too strong so any sudden movement and *peekaboo*! Maybe because I'm a D Cup, but I would recommend wearing a full coverage bra just in case.

Fits true to size. A nice orange red without being too bright. I have broad shoulders and big upper arms, but the sleeves weren't tight anywhere. The material was light for an evening outside on a hot summer day. I wore it over a fitted black tank dress. My main complaint is the gapping around the front snap, I kept having to adjust it.

As someone tall with a long torso I was not a fan of how short this was. I don't personally love that style because I feel like it cuts the body off weird and makes the hip belly area look bigger. The color is beautiful and fabric is nice and light. I wanted to love this.. just wish it was longer.
Was a little too low cut for work but great for weekend.

links_reviews_title: Not for the busty or size up
links_reviews_text: Cute top and fit great except too small at the bust. the snap to hold it in place would not stay snapped/was too small.
Great bright color, lightweight fabric, font closure button was constantly popping based on my chest size, definitely required a cami underneath unless you have a smaller chest

links_reviews_title: Cute but just not in love
links_reviews_text: The red turned out to be a little bit to orange, and I couldn't snap at in front but it was roomie everywhere else.

links_reviews_title: Button kept opening. Couldnt wear to work
links_reviews_text: Great color, snug in the bust area

Great color, nice fabric, very flattering! I have a small chest so didn't have too many issues with the clasp popping open, but would caution against renting this if you are bigger than a size A or B.

As many people have said the snap does not stay closed. To wear to work I had to wear an undershirt. Couldn't have really sized up because it would have been to bug everywhere else. That said it is still a cute top and doesn't look bad with a black tank underneath.

links_reviews_title: Runs a little short if you're tall.
links_reviews_text: The color is beautiful, and I was able to wear to work and with jeans on the weekend. However, it was a bit shorter than I expected. I'm tall, but have a short torso and am mostly legs, and I still felt it would have been more comfortable if it had been a bit longer.

links_reviews_title: Wayyy to big for me. Recommended size for both tops were too large, couldn't wear.
links_reviews_text: That v cut goes way too low. Couldn't wear to work without possibly layering, which wasn't happening when it's 80° out.
I normally wear a large but this ran small for me. The cheat was too tight and would not stay closed. I couldn't wear.

links_reviews_title: This one didn't work at all
links_reviews_text: The neckline is very revealing and wouldn't be okay at my work. I ordered a large (my normal size) and the bust area was extremely small yet all other areas were a good fit. The tightness of the bust area wouldn't allow the snap to stay together and there was no way this blouse was going to work for me. Full bust ladies should avoid this rental.

The wrap style is very low cut. There is a button on the inside by the waist, but the closure did not stay. There is also a snap to keep the front of the blouse closed, but it popped open with every stretch, reach and sneeze. I had to wear a camisole under it.
Loved it , it just was super right in the bust for me

The first runs fairly small and there is no give. I should have gone up a size. The waist cuts pretty tightly and despite the various button holes, it allows the shirt to gape a lot when sitting down. The snap button is not very helpful.

links_reviews_title: I didn't end up wearing this out because the fit wasn't good.
links_reviews_text: The front closure didn't allow much room for my chest and there was a gap where my bra was visible.
Tight across the chest

links_reviews_title: Got it for work, but sadly it didn't fit properly.
links_reviews_text: I love the color, but the fit was a bit puffy in some areas. The bottom part of the top was more bell-shaped than anticipated.

This wrap top has an interior button and loop with three options for fit at the waist. The fabric is light but polyester doesn't breathe. There's a snap at the top of the busy. If I were to buy it I'd have to replace the metal snap with a clear plastic snap. The sleeves are big and fun without looking ridiculous. I paired it with the J.Crew pleated midi skirt in denim and got many compliments. I would definitely wear it again! It would also be cute with skinny jeans or a wide leg pant.

links_reviews_title: Cute for work or a casual occasion
links_reviews_text: Wore this for a Friday workday - super cute and simple blouse! Fits nicely and looks classy.

links_reviews_title: Very cute, but runs very small
links_reviews_text: Adorable, but could not wear as it ran really small.
Loved everything about this. Great quality, fit well (adjustable as well) and very pretty.

links_reviews_title: Did not wear. It was way too small
links_reviews_text: Did not wear. It was way too small

Fit was so flattering! Looked great but arrived very wrinkled. No big deal, right? Wrong! Tag says you cannot iron it. How did anyone every wear this? I even tried hanging it in the bathroom while I showered but it remained very wrinkled. So cute, so frustrating.

links_reviews_title: Cute top, snap closure in the wrong spot
links_reviews_text: This top is a fantastic shade of red! I'm usually a medium in tops, but for coverage sized up. This top was very adjustable in terms of waist size since it's a true wrap and likely either would fit. The only problem was with the location of the snap closure on the neckline - on the top I was sent, it seemed to be too close to the inside hem and kept flipping so that the silver snap could be seen and creating a weird gape. Otherwise, a cute top!
Too small for a size 12. No stretch, no give.
Looks beautiful but runs 2 sizes to small. I am a 34b and it didn't fit at all

links_reviews_title: Too small on the chest. Have to use a tank top under. Fabric and stile are good...
links_reviews_text: #everyday wear

links_reviews_title: I got so many compliments on this top at my business casual office.
links_reviews_text: Low cut for work - I wore a tank top underneath. A little bit short - again easily remedied with a tank top. I would wear without a tank top on weekends.
Sleeves way too big.
Nice

links_reviews_title: Was too small to wear. Unless you have zero chest, it probably won't fit in a way you can wear.
links_reviews_text: Runs small. Didn't wrap well. Couldn't wear! But it is pretty.

Fit great everywhere except the chest - and I'm flat-chested! Couldn't keep the snap closed and I was "busting" out! A little short in the waist, too. Loved the way the sleeves fit, so I'm disappointed.

I originally rented for a ski trip but ended up just wearing it for self-quarantine :( Bad circumstances but surprisingly one of my favorite rentals EVER. This is sooo comfortable -- it's a soft knit material which isn't super easy to tell from the pics. The most stylish and fun loungewear. If you wanna feel cool at home, this is the outfit.
I wish I could wear a onesie everday.
It's a medium - I usually wear a small & I could probably get away with a small because it stretches. Would buy it it wasn't so expensive!

links_reviews_title: This onsie is a dude magnet-Rent this now!
links_reviews_text: I wore this to a concert. I thought I was too short to pull it off and would look like Celeste Barber, but it was actually fabulous. It is sweater material all over so it loosens over the evening. I had so many eyes on this Outfit-it was stunning-not me- the outfit. Many compliments from Men and Women. I wore it with black booties.

Usually a 6 but wore a L because I have a long torso. So it was a little loose in the arms and legs but in a cute way for the PJ-themed bday party I wore it to. So soft and comfortable! Great quality. But definitely a layering or lounge piece. It's not the kind of thing most people would wear on its own.

Rented this stunning piece for a snowboarding trip, and I’m sooooo happy I did. The soft wool was not itchy in the least, it kept me super warm, plus I looked cute for the lodge. This is a piece I would totally recommend for all winter sport trips
Small fit perfect in length as well!
So warm and comfortable. Wore it to a Onesie Christmas theme party. Fit tts and a bit long on my 5'2 frame. Fabric do stretch.
This adorable onesie will keep you warm and cute on the slopes. The knit will stretch so you can size down if you want a snug fit.
A little itchy but I loved it!
Love the cropped look and very warm. Just a little bit itchy.
I really love this sweater - it's a little itchy but fine with long sleeves underneath.
Just a great cozy sweater for the winter. Very casual.
I think it would have been cute in a smaller size but was way too big and therefore unflattering. It was also definitely itchy but had it looked cute I would have worn anyway.
Comfortable
Such a great, cozy sweater that's a little bit different. Love it and have worn it SO much
Wool a bit itchi. Other than that, nice and cozy for cool days

links_reviews_title: I wore this to a couple of backyard parties, and to work.
links_reviews_text: It has a nice fit, I enjoyed wearing it. While the quality of the garment as a sweater did not wow me, I would still recommend it for everyday use. It is nice and light, so perfect for spring and summer.

The style is loose on the sides. It fit true to size; sleeves were the right length - sometimes sleeves are too long on me so if you have long arms they sleeves could be short. I got this for a trip to Taos, NM and the sweater was a perfect fit. It could go with jeans, a skirt, or slacks easily. It's comfortable, cozy, and cute.
Since it's wool, it's itchy.
Should've listened to other reviews. It's short and boxy, very odd looking.
A little short waisted but cute
This sweater was everything I hoped it would be. Super comfortable/soft and went with everything. I wore it multiple times. Loved it so much I bought it via a different website new!

links_reviews_title: Wore it over a white turtleneck with boyfriend jeans to wine tasting in vineyards.
links_reviews_text: Boxy and wide- perfect to pair over turtleneck.
Boxy and hits at the hip which was a bit shorter than expected. Overall, cute, warm top to wear over a tshirt.
Warm and cozy sweater. Perfect for curling up in the cold weather. Wish it had been a little less boxy, but I think that's just the look.
The sweater was so soft, comfortable, and warm.
really cute but a little short for my torso - didn't end up wearing
Wore this over the weekend with jeans and leather pants, super comfy and cozy. The second one I rented was a bit more worn, but that happens with this fabric/material. Great rental for a ski trip :)
It was a little itchy, but OK if you wear long sleeve under it
Fun holiday print, and super warm
Cute
This sweater will keep you warm! So many compliments!
It runs a little large which is why I ordered the size 0. Loved the cropped fit, Overall, it's very warm and a great piece for weekend or casual wear.

links_reviews_title: Wore this everywhere! It's so soft!
links_reviews_text: Wore this sweater to work, at home, running errands, traveling. Nice and warm, super soft! Is a little boxy so beware!

This came with the tags still on. I wore it a few times while I had it and it was extremely warm (17% alpaca!) and fun to wear. I loved the material and the pattern. The fit was a bit short and I'm short so it may be pretty short on taller people. But still it was a great sweater!
This sweater is so easy to wear! Super cozy, the perfect weight, and adorable!

This is a great casual sweater. I wore it to work, running around town on the weekend, and as a cover up after spin class to brunch. I got compliments on this sweater every time I wore it. It was very soft. It's a little boxy, but worked will with fitted pants. It's a very warm sweater.

links_reviews_title: Loved it!! A little tight around my chest, but that shouldn't be a problem for most
links_reviews_text: Perfectly comfortable, loose and airy for an easy dressier look. I loved it! Really tempted to buy it (if only the chest fit a little better)

I would wear this jumpsuit every day of my life if I could! Fits true to size and the elastic back makes for a nice fit without feeling tight. Neckline hits in just the right spot and the fabric is so comfy and let go of all wrinkles with a quick steam. The perfect jumpsuit to just throw on and look effortlessly put together!
So comfortable and fabric is thick and tight enough in chest I didn't even need to wear a bra. Love that it has pockets too. Might be a keeper.

Enjoyed wearing this comfy jumper. Nice color, faded green. Love breathable linen. The only downside is the legs cut off at a kind of awkward spot on me so I found it a little tricky to pick shoes to wear with it in a more dressed up way.

links_reviews_title: good length for petites but straps go a little rogue
links_reviews_text: I wore a SR which was flattering and fit well but the straps were falling down a bunch. Tried it again w a tank underneath but that didn't really help. Hips were a little snug

I found this jumpsuit cute and the linen material was nice and light, but the waistline was very tight with no give. It wasn't too bad in length which is surprising on a petite person. I also was somewhat bothered that it seemed to pucker on the lower stomach, but perhaps that was just because the waistline was so tight.
In love with the color and fabric of this jumpsuit. The waist definitely cinches in, so the fit was tight for me there, but perfect everywhere else. A perfect look for the lake cruise I went on!

I styled this with a jean jacket and scarf because I wore it on a brisk spring day. Got compliments, very much my style, very comfy, and perfect to wear everywhere. I think it could be dressed up with the right kind of shoes as well.
Great for petites

links_reviews_title: Love, love, love this comfy linen jumpsuit!
links_reviews_text: Comfortable fabric that was easy to travel with. Fit true to size (although I am normally a small and received the extra small) Pockets!
Wore to lunch with some girlfriends and received many compliments. Im between a 12 and a 14 and the XLR fit well. Well made garment.

I wore this jumpsuit to a concert and out to eat with my husband. The color and fit is perfect. I wore it with platform sandals and minimal jewelry. I would absolutely rent again. I wore the large as it was more comfortable in length.
Loved this way more than I thought I would!! Totally my style - I'm almost regretting not buying it. Everything about it just fit so perfectly, like it was made for me!

This linen jumpsuit was very comfortable and great for a daytime family bbq. The top fit well enough that I did not need to wear a bra. But beware if you get underboob sweat as this linen does seem to show any tiny spot of moisture. Otherwise, this jumpsuit was great!

This jumpsuit was cute on the hanger, but fit oddly on my body. It was night around my hips which is not usually where I have a problem. It fit great around my 34DDD chest but I couldn't sit down because of the hips. Didn't end up wearing it.
Cute for summer evening date outdoors. Loved the color. Legs are wide which was great for my larger bottom half
Comfortable fit, perfect for pear shaped bodies.
So comfortable and flattering!

This jumpsuit is true to size and a great color! The material is a little thick, and, unfortunately, the zipper seemed to struggle with the fabric where it was doubled up at the waist. It zips up fine, but is particularly difficult to unzip - which isn't great for a jumpsuit if you plan to be out and about in it!
Pretty true to size. I liked it okay, it wasn't the most flattering cut at the top but was cute with a Jean jacket.

This item is a really nice color and the fabric is lightweight. I am a petite and had issues with how short the torso area of this romper was. It was very unfortunate because it rides up and it was just way too obvious to wear out. I also have a big chest but that was not a problem for this. As you can see, i got the item in XL since other reviewers said it ran small. I usually wear a medium or a size 10 and this fit perfectly everywhere else.

links_reviews_title: Loved the cut and fabric, just too small!
links_reviews_text: Loved the fabric and the overall style. It just wouldn't zip all the way up because it pinched in a little too style at the waist. I want to rent it in a size up though because I REALLY want to wear this!
Waist too small. Chest and legs fit normal. Must have a flat stomach to pull this off.
I'm not tall and I dont think I have a long torso. This seemed high waisted and the zipper was hard to operate. I ended up not wearing, though I wanted to like it. Nice feel to the fabric.

links_reviews_title: Ordered wrong size but would've been perfect otherwise!
links_reviews_text: Will definitely be reordering in the correct size, so cute and comfortable ! Am usually an XS/S but the XS was just too tight on my hips
love everything about this jumpsuit - color, fit and length! I have a short torso so it fit perfect for me, but if you have a longer torso it might not fit as well.

This is the first jumpsuit I've ever worn, and I loved it! I'm curvy, and it was extremely flattering and comfortable. I wore it to 5 dinners over 2 months and finally gave in and bought it! Easy to dress up or down.

This fit TTS and I loved that it had pockets. I wore this twice on a long vacation - once regular and once with a black tee over it (looked like cute pants!). It does wrinkle but not too badly. Hit me at an appropriate spot for my short height.

This jumpsuit is pretty casual, but I dressed it up with jewelry and wedge heels. The body was just a tad too short for my long torso, but still wearable. Perfect outfit for running errands and grabbing coffee!

I really liked this jumpsuit, but it wasn't for me. The buttons are the front are only sewn on and are non-functional. I'd been counting on the buttons to make it nursing friendly, so I ended up not being able to wear if. Only other comment is that it might run a bit small. I'm between a small and medium and the medium was tight in the waist.
Cute everyday jumpsuit. Wore it to work with a sweater and white heeled mules. If I were to rent again, I would likely size down because it was a little loose.
A little snug in the waist.
Entirely too small and definitely too cropped, even for me (I'm 5'4") I can't imagine someone taller than me trying to wear this. No stretch or give. I couldn't even zip it up.

I got so many compliments on this! It was light, airy, and a beautiful sage color. The back has some ruching right behind the chest, which gave it a lot of room. I have a larger chest, so this detail provided some extra space- I could have gotten away with the small. It also stretched out as the day went on! Straps are not adjustable, which would have been nice as well. Overall, it was a nice piece!
This jumpsuit was perfect in size length and color. Would rent again.
It has very nice light and comfortable fabric and fit me well.

I loved this jumpsuit. The cut was so flattering; definitely showed off all my curves; was easy to wear; and easy to take on and off. And because I'm short, the short length helps the jumpsuit not be too long on me. I'm glad I took a chance with this one.

This jumpsuit was very cute on and comfortable. I feel like it leans TTS to possibly running slightly large. I tried on the XL "back up" size first and it swam on me and the L fit perfectly with breathing room and I lean towards a size 12 currently (the back material has some give to it also) so might suggest size down for your backup instead of up.

links_reviews_title: Cute, breathable jumper for vacation or everyday wear.
links_reviews_text: This jumper is cute, comfortable and not too snug. I was planning to wear it for vacation or on the beach. Unfortunately it's still a bit chilly where I'm heading, so I'll save it for another time!
Most of the time a size 14 top fits me but I sometimes have to get a 16 pants. In this case the bottom fit okay but the top was too small. I am busty though.
This dress fit like a glove. Very true to size and also very comfortable. So happy with this selection. Highly recommend.
I wore this dress for a winter wedding. Without tights it would be impossible.

Wear with tights! Just barely covers your butt. I'm usually between a size 2 and 4 and the 4 was a bit tight. Probably could've work the 6 (and it would've been longer). But very cute and flattering for the winter.
Wore this to a non profit lunch event and got several complements. Slight too short for work. Fits true to size
Wore to a birthday party with tights and booties. The sleeves are long and the skirt is short. I really liked this one!

links_reviews_title: Super cute work dress. Glad I knew to size up!
links_reviews_text: A friend rented this a week before me and suggested I size up - glad I did, the 6 fit like a glove. Material is nice but thinner than I expected

I love everything about this dress: the color, the print, the silky fabric, the cut, the bell sleeves, and the mini length. I listened to the reviews and ordered one size up, which was the correct decision. I would rent this again in the spring because the fabric is pretty light, but it looked very good with tights and over the knee boots for cold weather. I wore it to work and to brunch. If you don't like minis, this is not for you. Otherwise, rent this (one size up!) ASAP !

links_reviews_title: Loved the print and little bell sleeves
links_reviews_text: Great pattern and detail in the sleeves, but the forearms were almost too tight
I love this dress! It's the perfect little dress for a pair of over the knee boots and tights <3

Wore this out tonight for my husband's birthday dinner / date night. I sized up based on other reviews & I'm glad I did. It was also a little short for my personal taste but was ok with tights & booties. This was a fun dress to wear!

I rented this for a fall bridal shower, and it was perfect! The fit is very flattering with subtle bell sleeves that were not too long. The green is muted but fun. I paired with the Emerald Carnival earrings and they were perfect. Received tons of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Great long sleeved dress that can be dressed up or down
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress in the winter in NY, once to work with thick leggings and knee high pointy-toe flat work boots (because it might be a little short for work if I work with no tights and heels) and then I jazzed it up for the weekend with sheer tights and higher heels. Great dress for every day and for work. The movement was lovely and I got several compliments.

I loved this dress! The pattern was fun and shape was great- loved the sleeves. This is definitely a short dress, I'm not even wearing shoes in this picture and I'm barely 5'6. I definitely felt a little self conscious when it was windy outside wearing it without tights. Besides the length concerns, loved this look. I would definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Too short but okay with tights
links_reviews_text: Lovely dress but a bit too short for my taste. Wearable with black tights. Sized up one...perfect fit. Silk is not silky. Feels more like a polyester. Compliments at work.
The bell sleeve is trendy (watch out while you eat). Very comfortable and cute. A little short for work so i paired it with black tights.

links_reviews_title: fun, flirty and pairs great with leather jacket!
links_reviews_text: ordered the 8 originally and it was sooo short and tight in the chest. ended up with the 10 and it fit perfectly. i normally wear 6/8 depending on the brand. ordered it originally for work to wear with tights but ended up wearing it to a night out. got a lot of compliments! would rent again.

This is a beautiful dress and i received dozens of compliments. Its 100% raw silk so the material isnt very giving, but it's very comfortable. On my figure it was little loose up top, and tight around the waste. I dont usually do patterns, so having the ability to rent it was awesome!
Loved this swing type dress. No real stretch in fabric so was a bit tight in my arms. Also short and I'm 5' 2". But super flattering and versatile dress!
I wore this dress to my company's holiday party, it was perfect! You can wear this dress up or down.. it has no limits!
Great fit and standout print. Loved wearing this dress. True to size and fit me well.

I loved this dress! It was so flattering and beautiful- definitely on the shorted side, but as a short person that never really affects me. It would say it ran slightly small, I probably could have squeezed into the 0 but I'm glad I went with the 2

This dress looks a bit average on the site, but I love ALC so gave it a shot. I was surprised by how much I loved it! It was one of the most flattering dresses I've ever worn- do yourself a favor and rent this.

I am not a tall woman (5'5") and am happy to wear a short dress if it fits. This dress was unwearably short. When I took it out of the RTR garment bag my boyfriend asked if it was a shirt! I chuckled, tried it on, and essentially agreed with him. Unless you're a legitimate petite or want to wear it as a tunic, this dress is not for you.

I couldn't really get a pic to do this dress justice but it was perfect enough to buy. I wore it out on my birthday in Vienna. It's lightweight, comfortable, and the perfect length...not too long, not too short. Also made my waist look deceivingly smaller than usual which is great if (like me) you beer binge and hard. Tricked people at a wine tasting into thinking I wasn't low class but if (like me) you find yourself chillin' at whatever Austrian sewer party you stumble into at dawn it's adaptable enough to stand out but blends in enough to say, "yo, I'm definitely NOT a narc meine guten Leute." 11/10.

links_reviews_title: This was a great dress for work to dinner date.
links_reviews_text: I wore this to wore and then straight to an event after and I thought it was a great piece for that. The print is flattering and easy to wear.

links_reviews_title: Way too short for work event
links_reviews_text: I didn't even see if it zipped because it was way too short for work

Lightweight silk, so it's good for summer but the long bell sleeves keep you comfortable inside a/c. The dress is a bit short but was fine for 5-5 me. The fabrice is a mix of dark green, black, and white. Loved this dress!

Quality and fabric was gorgeous! I rented a size 4 and it generally fit but was MUCH shorter than I expected and wasn't work appropriate. I will rent again in the next size up to see if that makes a difference

links_reviews_title: Pretty dress with a great pattern
links_reviews_text: Pros: pretty dress with a modern pattern. This dress is really comfortable to wear and shows off your legs. I originally rented this to wear to work but once I tried it on realized its a tad short for my office environment unless you wear opaque dark tights. I saved it for a dinner instead. Cons: none. I would rent this again.

links_reviews_title: Super short and awkwardly tight in the shoulders
links_reviews_text: I thought I'd love this dress, but it was super short, as in, if I lifted up my arms you could see some cheek. Ugh. The shoulders were also a bit tight. I'm an hourglass size 4 or 6, and this just didn't work on my body.
Loved the dress and the cut but was unfortunately super short and I'm only 5'2
Ran very short and a little bit small. Too short for work.
SIZE UP! After reading other reviews definitely go up a size. I'm usually a 4 and the 6 was perfect! A little short, but perfect with tights. Nice heavy material. Overall very flattering dress.
Loved the pattern! Thin material, shorter, very long sleeves (hung down to my knuckles instead of wrist area) and lots of static electricity - serious cling. Wore a different dress.

links_reviews_title: Too short to be worn as a dress
links_reviews_text: Loved the way it looked but the dress was way too short on me and the zipper at the back stuck out on the bottom. Looked like I had a tail.
This dress is super, super short! Like too short to wear with tights, must be worn with pants. I paired with a black stretchy pants and booties and wore to work.

links_reviews_title: It was such a great holiday party dress
links_reviews_text: It fit a little tight in the arms but the bell sleeve was wonderful and the length was party appropriate but not work.
short and easy dress. I am usually a 4 and the 6 was a little roomy but very comfy.

links_reviews_title: a little short, but cut is great.
links_reviews_text: a little short, but cut is great.
Runs so small, I couldn't even zip and have a tiny chest. Normally wear a 4 and this was so short and tight
I love anything military inspired and this is a combo of military and equestrian chic. It looks and feels luxe. I've gotten non-stop compliments.
No complaints here! Really cute cape, and fairly thick. It was perfect for 50 degree weather although I would wear something heavier under it for anything colder.
The coat is beautiful but at 5ft tall, I couldn't help but look like I was playing dress up in my mother's clothes. It was huge!

I was complemented on this sweater multiple times today. It's slightly cropped on a tall gal and requires high-waisted pants. I love the colors. It's a little itchy, so I wore it with a shirt underneath.

The fit was as expected, but it is definitely short-waisted, so I found myself pulling it down a lot. The fabric also had a lot of pilling. This sweater is very warm and the sleeves were a cute detail.

links_reviews_title: Not itchy. Loved the colors and puffy sleeves. Great with work pants for work as well

links_reviews_text: I have rented other items with puffed shoulders, and I usually find that are flattering. This one, however, made me look ridiculous. My daughter said I looked like Cinderella - not a compliment. Warm sweater, but not a winner for me
Shorter than I expected
A beautiful sweater that can be dressed up and down. Good if you have a short torso. I usually wear a 4/6 and the M fit perfectly.
Good colors. Okay fit. Runs small.
Fits a bit shorter at the waist for my frame. Sleeves are a little shorter too A fun balance of old and new in the puff sleeves!

This just didn't work for me. The puffy shoulders are much bigger and more exaggerated than I expected. The body itself fit nicely- snug but not too tight and a bit cropped. Sweater was already a bit pilled/fuzzed even one I got still had tags on.

links_reviews_title: Loved that it was reversible!! Such a chic jacket! A tad bit itchy but still so comfy

links_reviews_text: I rented this for my vacation in Ireland! It is a great every day cardigan. Kept me warm in 50-60 degree weather. Sometimes I felt like it swallowed me a bit, but it is an oversized cardigan so I guess that's the look! Overall happy

I wore it on a chilly summer night and it was perfect. I would rent this again for fall! It's a light beige on one side and a true grey on the other with two deep pockets. There were two slits on the side and cut off mid calf, I'm 5'4 and it didn't make me look shorter like some long cardigans and jackets do.
Warm but light and perfect for spring in seattle! I love this coat so much I don't want to give it back. I get compliments often. Can we worn with a dress or jeans.
It was great for work but very think and boxy for a curvy frame

This is why I love RTR. This coatigan was incredibly high quality and polished. It's super warm, comfy and structured. And...REVERSIBLE. I'm a size 10 and probably would have liked the medium better, but the large worked too. I'm not happy about sending this one back!
Great quality sweater...a bit long for someone 5"5, but I still liked it!

Gorgeous and warm. I wear this all the time. From the office to post-gym to nice dinner. Love that it is reversible, although the cream color is what I wore most of the time. It is long, so it looks best of you wear heels. Also - the static. Everything sticks, especially in the thick of winter. That said, I still love it. Keeps me warm when it's below zero outside :)

This was the first piece that I've rented and worn multiple times. This sweater feels so soft and luxurious. It's the perfect piece to make you feel expensive yet casual. It does run very large so size down.
Not a great options for petites due to the length of the sleeves and the width between the shoulders. High quality, soft wool though!
Great thick, structured cardigan coat. I am a 10/12 in tops and the L was large. Also quite long, hitting me below the knee at 5'8".
Absolutely gorgeous. SO many compliments on it. Runs a little big, order a size smaller if you can. But even if you can't, it's still adorable when it's a little baggy.
I wore this to work and out for everyday. Really cute jacket.
