I wore this mostly for the color on Vday, the material is so soft, and the sweater is so warm! I will say to size up, not that your normal size won't fit, but I think a size up would provide the fit you're looking for.
The sweater is loose-fitting and runs on the larger side. Really comfortable and effortless.
Overall, the cut is the sweater is flattering to curvy and busty body types. The quality and fabric was great!
Love the oversized fit, the side slits and the thick cable knit. Perfect for everyday look and winter in Colorado.
Love it so much

links_reviews_title: Great quality knit sweater that worked well for holiday looks
links_reviews_text: It fit a bit loose and flowy, and I didn't really love the saying across the front but it wasn't a deal breaker

links_reviews_title: SUPER COZY. But felt like it ran a tad small. I was expecting it to fit HUGE, as I'm usually a M.
links_reviews_text: Order size up.

links_reviews_title: I wore this on a Saturday--errands, visiting family, shopping, and to the movies. Regular smegular.
links_reviews_text: I'm busty (DDD, 10/12 tops) so I opted for the XL when I believe I could've had a large. The sweater is bright, festive, and comfortable. I wore it to the movies and shopping with jeans and biker boots and felt great. Very expensive feeling and not too warm (even though it is a medium/heavy weight sweater). Definitely recommend this for an everyday sweater but also could be dressed up with knee high boots and a skirt. This is my first sweater rental from RTR and won't be my last!
This blazer is very well constructed and gorgeous in person. It is oversized but not overly. Loved it.
Super gorgeous chocolate brown color - matches the bag I rented too!

links_reviews_title: So Chich! Size down one size
links_reviews_text: I love this blazer. It's not super warm, but I like that because it means I can wear it all day without getting too warm indoors. The buttons are an especially nice touch. I ended up rolling the sleeves as they were a bit long, and that showed the silk lining in a nice way too. The color is a nice, rich brown.

Wore multiple times. Loved it. Fit perfect - whatever size 10 is fit perfect. Looked best left open and sleeves rolled up as sleeves were long. Liking was cute. I thought it looked best over a white shell w dark jeans. Really loved the long lines this gave my v short body!

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love this but way too big
links_reviews_text: This was too big to wear. For reference, I'm usually a size 0 and I rented the smallest size they had in this. It was cute but I couldn't wear it unfortunately.

links_reviews_title: Way too oversized and fancy for everyday and a somewhat casual job
links_reviews_text: This was huge and I usually lovvve the oversized look. It's Very pretty but too fancy and oversized for me to wear to my somewhat casual job. If I were in entertainment, fashion, pr etc. I probably would have loved to wear it. But I just didn't feel comfortable enough to wear it to my normalish job. Looked like I got a blazer 5 sizes too big. I'm sure someone out there can pull it off tho!!
Wore this dress when vacationing here in Greece. Received tons of compliments. Loved the pattern and unique cut of the dress.
I forgot the dress had a cut out so I wore a bodysuit underneath and it was fine. I'll rent this again when I can show more skin. ;)
Definitely not your traditional dress. There's a lot of moving parts lol. But overall it's cute. I wore it for a birthday picnic. Airy material, slightly tight around hips but nothing uncomfortable.

links_reviews_title: It was cute but a bit small for my chest.

links_reviews_text: I rented it just because and wore it out to dinner. Super fun dress, a little odd but great. I thought about wearing it to work but the side cutout made me think twice. Beautiful silk and surprisingly flattering! Really enjoyed. I am straight and narrow/athletic, so definitely go up in size if you are curvy.

This dress fit me perfectly, it has a loose fit in the chest but is definitely slim fitting from the waist over the hips. I don't think it's the most flattering dress because there is a lot going on with the ruffles, ribbons and cut out at the side but it is Very runway fashion and fun to wear!

Okay, so between the print and the cut-out and the black strap and the frills, this dress is definitely doing the most. BUT... it all seemed to work! I wore it in Paris for vacation and it just felt right. And flattering! Not sure I would rent it for my real life but was fun to wear on vacation.

This dress is full of interesting twists and turns, but it really does all work out! The side "slit" at the waist and asymmetrical hemline balance each other out, and the grosgrain ribbon that wraps from front to back is really very elegant looking. I loved the pleating in the sleeves, too, and the button up front with the neck tie is a great finish. Overall the fabric is super luxurious and lightweight, and the print is perfect for spring-summer daytime or evening outings.
The fit was great!
I should have gotten the next size up because the fit was not ideal, but I loved the style of the dress! I might consider renting it again in a different size.

This dress was strange. I couldn't figure out how to put it on, at first. Once I had it on, though, it was really tight across my hips and butt. I'd definitely recommend sizing up. Also, the material is very thin....I didn't wear it out.
I would say size up!!
this dress is fun and unusual. cute for dinners and happy hours

links_reviews_title: runs very small, light weight fabric
links_reviews_text: felt 2 sizes too small and the fit seemed off. also In a very light weight fabric, almost see through even with the print
This fit well, looked very tailored. Sleeves are the perfect length. The fabric is wool, great for cool weather.

links_reviews_title: High quality, looks good. But not as flattering as the pants.
links_reviews_text: The matching pants were pretty much my all time favorite, was hoping the same. Still, very nice.
Loved wearing it. It was cozy and soft and looked great too
This suit fit perfectly. Soft but excellent quality. Random people on the street complimenting me
A little manly when open. More flattering closed
This was a fine blazer, but nothing special. It was a tad bit long. It was just blah.
Wore with the matching pants for a warm winter look. The jacket is very long, so wasn't the most flattering on me. The fabric is very thick - definitely for a cold day or cold office.
This is super nice. Very fitted and long. Thicker soft fabric. Really nice. Wish I could buy

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous blazer for a conservative work environment!!
links_reviews_text: Very obviously super high quality, gorgeous low-key blazer. I wore to work with black cinq-a-sept pants, black Rachel Zoe cami, gold & pearl drop necklace, and black Gucci pumps- felt like a million bucks. Would also look great if you simply swapped the black pants for jeans, and added more statement jewelry. Definitely a very heavy/warm blazer- so best for ladies in cold climates during the winter.

Great for work. Fabric was nice and thick. I went with the RTR siize recommendation and the 50 ended up being too big for me (I kind of looked like Uncle Fester) but it didn't stop me from loving the outfit. If I rent again, I'll be sure to pay better attention to the sizing.

links_reviews_title: Warm, well-tailored, professional piece for work.
links_reviews_text: This well-made blazer fit me perfectly. Not too tight or too lose. True to size. Also, it kept me warm on cold days, even when wearing only a blouse under it, while being appropriate for work.

links_reviews_title: Maybe not great on shorter folks
links_reviews_text: At 5'4" the length of this looked terrible on me. Might work better for taller folks
Great blazer. Looks great with the pants. I'm tall with long arms and legs and a short waist. Waist was too long, arms too short. Nothing worse than an ill-fitting jacket.
This suit fit like a dream, has the softest fabric and makes you feel like a million bucks - love, love, love.

I rented the blazer and corresponding trousers for an interview for a surgeon job within an academic surgery department. This suit combination fit true to size, was incredibly comfortable, and was conservative without being drab. The pants were ankle length at an inseam of 28, not cropped as the picture appeared. I was able to wear booties with a slight heal and they didn't look too short or weird. (I'm 5'8") The jacket has two buttons and nipped at the waist just right, so I had curves rather than a fat boy look or a gapping jacket. The suit was also comfortable without being too warm, perfect for a northeast interview in December. This will be interview suit as I look for other jobs, and am considering purchasing. Warning, this suit is NOT for warm weather.

links_reviews_title: It was work; it was a nice change up to wear and comfortable...It was classic, will order again.
links_reviews_text: Plenty of room in the upper arms where I need it.
Fits well
Fabric is a little heavy. Great pattern.

links_reviews_title: Really liked this. Wore it for work with black trousers; and casual with leggings.
links_reviews_text: Fit is perfect; fabric heavy and soft like flannel, so great for chilly days.
Just FYI, the lining is navy blue. I ended up wearing it only once as a result, since I generally wear all-black outfits.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful quality. So warm. Very big.
links_reviews_text: It's so heavy weight, perfect as a light coat alternative. It's definitely not cardigan like material as is thick wool. I am a size 6 and got a medium, which is huge.
Wish I could buy this as I'd wear it every day!
Very long and heavy, but good quality. Would be nice in the winter.

links_reviews_title: Sleek and chic, easy to wear
links_reviews_text: Turns inside out for navy or black. Perfect warm wool transitional overcoat

links_reviews_title: Went with many outfits- easy to dress up or dress down
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable
Larger fit, but beautiful draping and construction. Reversible Navy/ black
I get lots of compliments on this. I am keeping it for another month.
More like a coat than a sweater. Reverses from black to navy. Nice but not WOW.
Great quality and cut. Approximately oversized for the style. Contrasting liner is a nice touch.

links_reviews_title: Just ok - basically a fancy bathrobe
links_reviews_text: Thick, warm, soft and super comfy. Perfect for lounging around the house. A little casual for work, quite honestly - definitely has bathrobe vibes. Goes to just below the knee. The way the sweater is cut makes it hang oddly - there is a slit up the sides to about upper knee/mid-thigh area, which makes for separate back, left, and right panels - and with the material the way it is (almost a felted, substantial knit), the panels stuck out instead of draping smoothly and it looked frankly a little ridiculous. That being said, I still wore it every day for a week!
Love it!
Too big in shoulders
This sweater is super warm and comfortable, perfect for everyday weekend wear. The only thing is it was pretty big - I recommend sizing down, although the size didn't bother me much!

links_reviews_title: I needed some additional layering pieces and this worked out well though it's a little boxy
links_reviews_text: Warm!!
This has been one of my favorite items from RTR- It's warm, comfy, and looks classy
Very boxy, but super warm, ended up wearing around the house to keep warm. Didn't end up wearing it out. Attracts a ton of lint and dog hair too. But super warm!

Only hard part was deciding how to wear it, because it could go with tons of outfits. Very thick and good quality, it didn't feel like the sleeves were stretching as the day went on. It is very long though.
Very high quality
If you are short this does not go to mid thigh, more like mid shin.
Love the fit and look of this heavy sweater/coat. Didn't realize it was reversible until after wearing it once. Draped really nicely and was warm enough to wear as a jacket.
I love this duster but it's very thick and warm for running errands when it's rainy and 50 degrees. I'll consider it again for the dead of winter
Wore on a date. A little loose in the mid section on me but for perfect everywhere else
I really liked this dress! It was very comfortable and the sleeve ruffles and the cutout details made it special. I wore it for work and a brunch.

This dress is very comfortable - there is no slip so it isn't as forgiving on my curves but I still decided to wear it to work. Got a compliment on it already! I am normally a size 14 or 16 and had to get an XXL - I think anything smaller would have been too tight. Could look great with black tights underneath but I opted to go without today. Feels like sweater dress material.

links_reviews_title: Good stretch, runs a little large
links_reviews_text: I liked this dress. I'm normally a M or L but went with a large based on the recommendations. However, I think I would have preferred a M. The neckline scooped a little farther than I would prefer and the sides fit, but could have been a little more snug; if I moved the wrong way, it kinda bunched up in spots. I would definitely get a M if I decided to order it again.
Dress was super comfortable and hugged in all the right places just make sure to watch the sleeves from going into your food.

Wore to church on Christmas Sunday! Got lots of compliments and it was very comfortable. I should have gone with a medium but large was all that was available. High quality and cute! I did feel like it can easily show lumps and bumps though.

links_reviews_title: Love this! Great sexy style but still work appropriate.
links_reviews_text: It was a great dress and I got a lot of components. I was worried it was a little stretched out in the butt but it didn't show/actually feel that way. I think sweater style dresses always have a bit of that worry for me.

This was so pretty but I probably could've gone with the small rather than XS. It was for the work day and a work event that evening and it was perfect for both. If there's any bloating or tummy pouch this will show it - just wear spanx or something underneath to suck you in if that's an issue!

links_reviews_title: Nice not quite sweater material dress
links_reviews_text: For was great. Just right amount of stretch but didn't stretch out. Nice for Fall
Cute maternity option. Nice stretchy soft material
The sweater material is comfy but so clingy that I needed something under to keep things smooth.

links_reviews_title: Everyone said this was my color!
links_reviews_text: The color is so rich and beautiful. This a great statement dress, when you are wanting to look great but not flashy. I kept it to wear to a conference the next weekend I loved it so much!

I love the look and feel of this dress. It's simple yet the detail on the arms gives it a nice touch. It's perfect for a business casual with flats or dress it up a bit with heals. The only downside is you can't wear a blazer with it if you need to be in business attire. Fit is perfect and it's not too low cut for the office.

links_reviews_title: Unforgettable burgundy color with a lush thickness
links_reviews_text: #glamourous and so easy to revel in. I'm a classic xl and was glad to have ordered and xxl. It glided over my shape wear and never lost its lines over a long work day. The flare sleeve bottom highlight every movement #sommelierapproved #onlypourthebestinthisdress. Cheers to a sexy little sweater dress! Pair with a glorious oversized necklace -
Fit perfect

This sweater dress is not overly tight. The color is rich and beautiful and the sleeves have nice detailing. I was able to pair with black, cream, and navy/denim to create different looks so it was very versatile.

This is what a knit/sweater dress should be. Thick fabric that clings in all the right places. Very slimming through the middle and just enough of a neckline without being too revealing. Beautiful color. Loved it and loved me in it all day!

The color and cut of this dress are absolutely stunning, and completely hug your figure. Unfortunately - my currently out of shape mid section had nowhere to hide in this dress so I wasn't able to wear it, but I'm certain anyone who does wear it will get tons of compliments!
Really beautiful color and shape. I would size up for sure.

links_reviews_title: Pretty color. Great for younger bodies.
links_reviews_text: A bit snug for me. Since it is a solid, shows lumps and bumps!
It runs a little big in relation to size, but that helps hide bloating. Really cute sleeves! Very flattering and a little sexy but also very proffesional. Great color
Nice fit !
Perfect in every way! Length, style, quality, flair, color...loved it!
Wonderful fit and super comfortable. Would rent again!

Good quality fabric. Not itchy like some sweater dresses. Good length. I'm 5'4 and it hit me right at the knee. Would be just above the knee on someone taller. Flattering color and fit. Will rent again!

links_reviews_title: Love it. Rented it twice. Super comfy
links_reviews_text: Lovely arm detail, soft, warm. Beautiful color.
The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star rating is because the belly is very unforgiving. The material and color are very nice and the sleeves make the dress.

This is a great heavier fabric, beautiful wine color and form fitting. The cutouts on the sleeve are great. This was too firm fitting for me to wear to work but I wore it out to a show. I didn't wear any spanx or slips but am comfortable with showing my curves without feeling like I need to constrain my body. All in all - very cute
Very clingy. I am typically a 6 or an 8 and ordered a medium. It felt so clingy that I didn't feel fully confident. Make sure you have good pair of spanx or size up.

links_reviews_title: dress with enough detail to feel a little special, but very comfortable
links_reviews_text: bell sleeves are stylish but not too long, so they are not a pain to deal with if you are eating a meal in the dress. It it made of a knit material that I expected would be a bit heavier. It is a lighter weight knit and so will reveal lines and bulges.
form fitting, yet very comfortable. Nicely made, I love Trina Trunk's style
Beautiful color, flattering style. Recommend.

links_reviews_title: Love it!!! Fits great and no wrinkles
links_reviews_text: As someone who is tiny in the waist and hips but has a larger chest this dress was a dream come true! The stretchy fabric fit perfectly and it was so comfortable!

links_reviews_title: Fun, warm dress for Fall and Winter!
links_reviews_text: This dress fit very well, but is definitely form fitting. Got lots of compliments on the deep rich color and style. I'd rent again and definitely recommend!
This dress was extremely comfortable and flattering for my figure. It was not tight on me, which I expected given the other reviews.

Heavy sweater like material.. pretty dress .. but if you have any bumps or bulges a good pair of spanx can't fix - this dress is not forgiving. I tried it on 3 times because I loved it - but my rolls showed .. so ultimately didn't wear.

Nice dress, not too heavy or too light. I'm usually between a small and medium. I wore a medium in this and it fit nice. I had a baby 8 months ago so i have a little belly and you could kinda see it in this but if i had a "less fluffy" look then i would have gone with the small and it would probably fit nicely
Comfortable, very flattering

links_reviews_title: I want to keep these forever!
links_reviews_text: Love the hem on these jeans! They can be dressed up or dressed down so easily. Great fit and just adorable!
No stretch. Look adorable with ankle boots. Would definitely rent again.
Sized up, felt cool, looked cool

links_reviews_title: Assumed i should size up but i recommend renting TTS
links_reviews_text: Loveeee renting denim, because i refuse to buy jeans while I'm working to lose weight - and while all these trendy cuts are in style! it's been really fun to experiment and these frayed jeans are no exception. Here i paired them with a Finders Keepers top (also RTR) but i also wore them with white linen and black silk - wow i wore them 3x in a week huh :) definitely would rent again but would probably rent my typical size. More pics at @thanksitsrtr
Love the fringe at the bottoms! Otherwise these would be pretty basic. Size up because there are definitely stiff and straight. Overall stylish for a casual look.
Fitted, light wash

I really wanted to love these but, unfortunately, they didn't fit me right. They were little big around the waist but so tight around my thoughts that I could hardly move. They have zero stretch so they're definitely for gals with tiny, tiny legs.
Cropped for any type of shoe and fit for any occasion. Tight enough to turn heads, but comfy enough to dance in this denim.
Amazing! Great fit. Love the multiple buttons. No stretch on this pants so make sure you go a little bit big if you're on the edge of 28 and 29. Tight on butt in a good way
So comfortable, the perfect length, great jeans
Loved these jeans, perfect cut on 5'2" - 26 fit perfect for a tighter fit (and super flattering) - but if you want the baggy boyfriend look I'd size up
Great fit and material. Love the cuttoff at the bottom.

Was really excited to wear these pants but was nervous about fit so I sized up to 28. I'm a true 6 and the waist on these were loose but the legs were tight. I think a 27 would've been too tight on the thigh. Overall i liked the vintage, casual look.

Love these jeans! The perfect blue color, and the raw hem adds extra edge. These run pretty true to size with minimal to no stretch. My typical size 25 fit and even had a bit of room. Love that they are more high waisted, great for everyday!

I rented these jeans for weekend wear. I should've gotten a 27 because they were big and baggy- I needed a belt. But the jeans were comfy and easy to style with big sweaters, t-shirts, and vans. I felt very trendy.

links_reviews_title: Runs true to size. Don't size up.
links_reviews_text: Wish I had ordered my true size, rather than sizing up.

links_reviews_title: A more interesting pair of jeans for work
links_reviews_text: True to size, however, tight in the thighs and a little loose in the waist without any give. Didn't love the fit--made my legs look a bit stocky, but love the raw hem at the bottom for an elevated denim look.

links_reviews_title: I liked them and wore them about 6 times
links_reviews_text: good
Fit perfectly, very cute for every day.

links_reviews_title: Loved these very current, very comfortable jeans.
links_reviews_text: LOVE these super-loose boyfriend jeans. I would wear these every day if I could. So comfy! They were very roomy. I would go a size down next time I rent (and I do hope to rent these again as soon as the size 27 becomes available)!!
Too uncomfortable to wear

I loved these, and paid attention to other reviews that noted the slender legs. I sized up to a 30 and the waist was big but thighs were still very snug. They were very flattering and I liked them overall, but was glad to know about the zero stretch and slender thigh issue before I ordered!

I get it, it's a style right now. But this MOM is not buying it. Might be good for a younger festival-going person, but for me they just were not flattering. Bulgy in the parts you don't want to bulge... And while the leg fit is modern and cool, and I love the hem, with a baggy butt and crotch area, just not a cute look for me.

Was excited for these jeans. I am 7 weeks post-partum and not back in my pre-pregnancy jeans so was hoping for a cute pair of everyday jeans. Sized up on these, but they were still way too tight in the thighs and gaped in the back of the waist. Not accommodating for curvier girls at all. These would be great if you were built more straight. Didn't wear.
Tight in the thighs, but everywhere else fit fine
These are some serious mom jeans

I'm usually a 28, I couldn't even get these over my thighs! (I do workout so I have toned lets but still....Wasn't even remotely close to fitting) However, the denim coloring and fabric is really nice - I'm swapping these now and going 2 sizes up.
exactly as pictured, very cute.
So disappointing! I love other 3x1 jeans so was excited for the raw hem style. No stretch at all and couldn't even fit them over my quads/butt. Sent back immediately.
Normally an 8 and I could not zip them up
I love the style and design but the fit was too boxy for me. Best for straight body type. Tight in thighs and huge in waist for me!

links_reviews_title: The legs fit but the waist was slightly loose. Not very flattering on shorter legged people.
links_reviews_text: The legs fit but the waist was slightly loose. Not very flattering on shorter legged people.

links_reviews_title: These jeans are not for anyone with curves!
links_reviews_text: There is no stretch to these jeans whatsoever. They are cut for girls with no hips or booty. So if you don't have either of those things, you and these jeans might be a perfect match! I'll have to try a different pair!
Length works for shorter girls. Boyfriend-ish fit. Stretch out a bit after 2-3 wears so size down if on the fence

I absolutely loved these jeans! Although, I did order them 1-2 sizes too large. Given that the denim does stretch a bit, a 29 or 28 would have fit significantly better. I loved the way these jeans looked with my more formal stretch knit booties. Highly recommend!
Loved. Perfect fit for me.

I love the cut and fray on these. That being said, these were crazy tight on my thighs (I have pretty big, muscular thighs) and gaped about 3 inches at my waist... I couldn't even wear them haha. I don't recommend if you've got a more muscular physique.

links_reviews_title: Just needed some comfy fun jeans for the weekend . . . and these fit the bill perfectly.
links_reviews_text: Comfortable, flattering on the booty--good length with cute tennis shoes.
I'm usually a 27 & I couldn't even button these. Although they are super cute the denim has no give & is very restricting. Definitely size up if you want these to fit you comfortably

I was so excited to finally get to rent these! Unfortunately, even though I sized up (I'm normally a 26/27 in denim across brands and got a 28 because of reviews!) these fit really snug at the waist and just uncomfortable. I didn't end up wearing them because of the waistline. They were very flattering just fit snug for all those ladies who have larger hips like me!

I was expecting this to be a slouchy, boyfriend-style blazer and was a bit disappointed to find that even though I ordered a size up it was a bit tight in the shoulders. It's a nice blazer and I wore it a bunch while I had it, but definitely not as high fashion as I wanted it to be.

links_reviews_title: Could work as a blazer or a jacket
links_reviews_text: A bit oversized, with straight cut. Thick blazer, which can be worn as a jacket. I love the pockets, good size for an iPhone plus.

links_reviews_title: Great blazer!! Size up for a true oversized look
links_reviews_text: I loved the blazer! Great material. If I were to order again I was size up. It was a little tight in the shoulders.
Quite warm and high quality. Nice herringbone, felt very London
The fit was true to size. Longline blazer that hit at mid thigh. It had clean lines and was a good material weight. Would rent again.
At first thought this was too boxy to wear to work, but once I tried it with a skirt I loved it! Definitely fun and comfy!

I wasn't sure how I felt about oversized blazers until I rented this piece. The blazer was definitely oversized, even for a tall gal, but the fabric didn't feel like I was swimming in the fabric. I enjoyed elevating my every day looks, as it inspired more confidence—I stood taller. My go-to style was to wear a thin black turtleneck, black skinnies, and lace up black booties. #interview #interviewoutfit #casualoutfit #oversizedblazer
Oversized blazer. Styled well with dark jeans. Fabric on the thicker side. Recommend for fall/winter.
Love this stylish and well made garment

I like the oversized look of this blazer, but it is a tad boxy and the sleeves are a little bit too long. The print is cute and definitely a piece I could wear to work, however, I don't think I would purchase it since it is made out of polyester.

Loved this for work, I dressed down a bit with jeans and it was perfect. The shoulders were structured but fitted so it didn't make me look body. Flattering but comfortable and the tweed menswear feel felt right on trend!
This one is one of my favorite! Easy to wear with style. Check my IG for more pics! @Candice5bonbon

My first piece from this brand and I really liked it! Very comfortable but still structured and professional. The sleeves were a bit long. Fits true to size. Would look great with jeans as well. Great pattern for fall/winter.
It's a little warm for Southern California but was perfect for a work trip to Chicago. Looks great with slacks or jeans.
This blazer is so comfortable. It has just enough stretch to be comfortable at work but still had a flattering cut and structure. I keep reaching for it.

links_reviews_title: Got a few compliments in the elevator at work
links_reviews_text: The stretchy fabric made it comfortable to wear. Cute and easy to pair with pants.
Wonderful work blazer, but definitely for cooler weather. The fabric is pretty thick.

links_reviews_title: Couldn't wear jacket due to tear in seam.
links_reviews_text: This jacket was a bit long in the sleeves and torso for a petite. I didn't actually get to wear it because there was a tear in the seam where the left sleeve connects to the main trunk of the coat behind the left arm.
I didn't order the right size; should have sized way down.
Oversized but fits proportionally even on a small frame
I absolutely loved this jacket. I used it to dress up a black dress for work and wore it with jeans. It worked great for both. Also, way more comfortable than a suit jacket usually is.

links_reviews_title: Not everything I had hoped for, but still a nice jacket
links_reviews_text: I was excited about this jacket - the reviews were good and it promised to be the boyfriend jacket I had been searching for, perfect for a work trip. It was just ok. The cut is baggy, which is the style, and it is very soft and comfortable. I thought it ended up being a little too unstructured to be flattering, and while it could have been improved with a belt over top, the 6 was too big for me to do that. I think sizing down may have helped with fit and made it possible to belt, so there'd be more options.
Lots of compliments; recommend sizing down if you are narrow/short torso

The style is oversized, so the proportions are fairly large and loose. The jacket fit across my shoulders pretty well (I'm 38" around the shoulders) and the length of the sleeves were perfect even though my arms are fairly long (I'm 5'7"). The lining was really soft and silky and the blazer was really nice and warm.
I worn this with a slim skirt and liked the look. It was very comfortable but the sleeves ran a little long

I loved this blazer. It was structured, but also very soft and warm. It has more of a boyfriend feel, and at first seemed a bit over-sized, but it fit my shoulders nicely. I thought it was most flattering when I had something fitted underneath.
This blazer looks adorable with almost any outfit--works great with jeans or dress. It can dress up a casual outfit, or just be a cute jacket for light fall weather. Dreamy.
Looks polished, not heavy, not an actual weave, but a patterned fabric. Comfortable. Wore it several times to work.

links_reviews_title: Great blazer - really soft and warm, and dressed up my basics well.
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size.
Perfect for meetings
While this was a bigger warmer jacket it didn't feel huge like some might. Loved the color and the high collar.
Super thick jacket. Would rent again. Not good material to ski in!

links_reviews_title: Exactly what I wanted in a puffer
links_reviews_text: Super warm, puffy and fashionable puffer. The hood is quite deep- I felt like a Sith wearing it up. Only complaints is that it can be impossible to fold up (for planes or the grocery cart) cause it's so big and the pockets were a little far back.

links_reviews_title: I live in MN and this is super warm and now I am waiting to wear it when it goes under 32 degrees!
links_reviews_text: Fits great and the collar can go as high as to cover your cheeks. It is stylish as well! Love it!

links_reviews_title: Big warm looked like I was in a Kanye west video
links_reviews_text: It's seriously oversized- adds about 8 " of girth to your whole body. Personally couldn't pull it off. My colleague and I had a good giggle at how I looked.
Very comfy, warm, and soft on the inside. The sleeves with the thumb hole was a nice feature. It definitely was very large though and super puffy!
I ordered a Large because that was all that was available and it was too big. Way too big. But I wore it once anyway. It is so cute. VERY warm, great for frigid cold temperatures if you have them!!!
I loved this coat! The compliments were endless and I loved that the pockets were lined! The sleeves even came up to cover your hands and there are holes for your thumbs. Definitely will rent again!

Love love love this coat. Most likely going to purchase as my everyday winter jacket. Bought for trip to Colorado and it was perfect because it snowed like 8 inches while I was there. Easy to pack. SO warm but also I felt bad ass in it. Very nice down coat.

links_reviews_title: Well made but arms VERY short.
links_reviews_text: I loved all the details of this jacket, the color, and how well it is made, but the arms are VERY short, so I never wore it.

These jeans are super cute and I keep getting compliments in them!! Perfect to casually wear to dinner or can totally be dressed up. The fit is flattering and comfortable but they definitely run small.. I normally wear a 26 and these were still a little tight around my hips when putting them on. Overall love them though and might have to buy!!:)
These pants fit perfect but we're just a little short so I had to wear taller booties with them. I am 5'10" though so take this into consideration,

links_reviews_title: These pants were so fun to wear!
links_reviews_text: Color is great, fit is great and compliments every time I wore them. The high waist is actually flattering around the midsection even in my case. I wore these multiple times with heels and boots and seriously considered buying them, still may. BTW I'm 5'6 and you can see these came just to the top of my combat boots.
Loved these jeans. Super comfy and easy to wear. They are high waisted so they get a little bit wrinkly when you're sitting but this isn't a huge deal. TTS.

These are super cute but they run TIGHT. I normally wear a 27/28 but I am just squeezing into these 29s. But that's how I want them to fit so for sure order a size up. Also the length is a tad odd-not quite a crop as it looks on the model but also not quite ankle length. I cuffed under so it hit where I wanted. Overall I love these.

links_reviews_title: Fun corduroys but DO NOT size up too much or this will happen!
links_reviews_text: Love the cropped length & softness. The corduroy pants DO have some stretch (contrary to other reviews) and that bit of stretch is the difference between sexy (I would kill for the booty of the woman who thought they were too tight) and my Frumpy Mom fit. I normally wear a 27 and ordered a 29 based on advice. 28 would have been perfect. Pants like this should be a little tight to put on, and they give a bit after your body warms them up. The 29's looser high waist was comfy for work tho.

LOVE these pants. I couldn't tell from the photo and didn't pay attention to the description, so I didn't realize that they were corduroy until they arrived. It was a pleasant surprise. Such a fun color for fall and I love the fit! Kept them for two months because I liked them so much.

I should have trusted the reviews and ordered a size up (27). I can button these jeans but they have zero stretch and a pretty uncomfortable in the 26, which I my typical size. Otherwise pretty a cute fall look.
Perfect fit, minimal stretch. I'm going to buy these.
x
Runs super small. Going to try again a few sizes up

links_reviews_title: Fun pants in unique color for stylish look everyday and work
links_reviews_text: They were a bit tight in the crotch area, would size up next time because runs right/small but looked great for a day. The color is GORGeous and the corduroy is very soft
These are lovely but I had to size up 2 sizes from my normal 28 and they were still a little tight.
I wear 6 and sized up twice to 30. The waist JUST fit me - it was snug after a meal or sitting down. Great pants otherwise. The fabric is a little stiff and not very warm.

links_reviews_title: Snug fit but flattering and versatile.
links_reviews_text: I sized up as recommended by others and glad I did. Still a tight fit but a flattering high waist cut and stiff corduroy fabric that makes for a nice silhouette.

I am normally a 27 or 28 and got a 29 based on other reviews and they fit perfectly. They are super comfy, sooo fall, and looked fashionable with just a simple black sweater and booties. I also rented the Greylin Rust Boucle Coat which is an amazing coat and matched these pants perfectly. My life was a crap show during this rental and I ended up wearing this same exact outfit 3 times to different things because it was warm and comfy and looked intentional and made my life a little easier.

links_reviews_title: I love these pants and kept renting them until I bought them.
links_reviews_text: These pants run small but after squeezing into the 29 for a month, I then rented the 31 and it fit perfectly. Get these 1-2 sizes up unless you like being a sausage.

I'm a true 6- usually 27 or 28 in most jeans. Ordered the 30 in these based on reviews and they are perfect fit. Great color and cut. However, arrived with 2 grease stains on the legs. I was still thinking about buying them but i wore them all day when I was going from sitting to standing a bit and I would look down periodically and notice the fly had come unzipped on its own so will not be purchasing these but worth it for the few-day fall rental!!
so cute! i definitely thought about buying these for weekend attire. very comfy and gave me shape!

I usually wear 24 or 25. I think the 26 would've fit but it wasn't available. :( the length was of course right at my feet because I'm short. Sometimes the length will hover right above my ankles, but not these.
Loved these but they run super small with no stretch. I had to size up twice. Will likely order again and then buy

links_reviews_title: so cute. fits amazing. obsessed with the style.
links_reviews_text: will wear these everyday
I sized up one size based on the reviews and these pants fit perfectly! They were comfy and I got tons of compliments. Will rent again!

links_reviews_title: I'm tall these fit nice but super short. They are very worn and faded
links_reviews_text: Sort legs but nice high waist

links_reviews_title: A nice way to change up the jeans
links_reviews_text: I loved the color and they had the right amount of stretch. I normally wear a size 27 in Levi's and for these I sized up to a 28 and they fit perfectly, not even a waist gap! I'm 5'5" and wish these were about an inch shorter and just slightly tapered at the end, but that's just me. Regardless, I'd honestly still wear them again.

links_reviews_title: The color of these are fun and perfect for the fall halloween season.
links_reviews_text: They were high rise pants and fun to wear, but I felt that they ran small. I wore them and enjoyed them!
Cute pant and a nice fall color. I'm pretty tall and wish these were about 2 inches longer. Only wore once
these are comfortable. I am usually a 2-4 or 25-27. I ordered the 29 and it fit, I suspect the 28 would have also but would have been tight in the butt. Definitely runs small. good quality!
I normally wear a 27 but sized up to a 29 based on reviews. These pants have no stretch or give, so I would recommend the same. They are super cute when they fit, though!
Ran so small. I normally wear a 30 but got a 31 and went up to about my knees.
Very snug fit with no stretch. Color and style very cute for fall! Didn't end up wearing bc it's not cold enough outside yet, will rent again this winter.

links_reviews_title: Great color, these are corduroy not denim, very snug!

links_reviews_text: I usually wear a 29-30, and I ordered a 32 per the reviews. They fit great! They are so soft and comfortable. They are VERY high waisted so they gape a little in the back, but otherwise the length and everything is great. Not to mention the burnt orange color is perfect for fall!!
I wanted to love these but they run so small. I wear a 27-28 in most pants but couldn't even get the 28's on
Cute texture and color but runs very small.
The 32s fit more like 29s. I couldn't get them over my hips. Size up if you can.
This is a little oversized but I'm obsessed. I've layered it with dresses, worn it to work with jeans and to the beach. I'm going to buy it for sure!
Wore this while traveling to and from the airports nice comfy, oversized sweatshirt that is dressier than your average pullover. Highly recommend.

I love how comfy the sweater is. It's so perfect for a June Gloom kind of day. I am 5'10 and regularly wear a 6-8 in jcrew. It is short and boxy around the waist and short sleeve length. Fun easy wear if it fits you right.

links_reviews_title: Great vintage vibe, cozy and tons of compliments
links_reviews_text: Perfect everyday casual sweatshirt

This runs big but I loved wearing it. The blue part is fuzzy the way a Patagonia jacket sometimes is if that makes sense. I didn't want to send it back. It's unique enough to make you feel like you are wearing something more than an ordinary sweatshirt.

links_reviews_title: Comfy oversized sweatshirt. Perfect for looking chic while just hanging out.
links_reviews_text: The fit was a little large but I was looking for an oversized look. Paired great with skinny jeans or leggings hanging out by the beach. It's light weight which made it perfect for vacation! Wouldn't have expected anything more - great rental!

links_reviews_title: I did not wear this to an event, just for everyday wear.
links_reviews_text: The fit is meant to be oversized. It is slightly boxy, but super cute. I wore it with jeans and sneakers for a casual, everyday look.
really enjoyed this sweatshirt and will rent The Great items again!

I didn't think much of this sweatshirt when I rented it but when it arrived I knew I loved it. I got it for a trip to San Fransisco and it was perfect as a layer when it got cooler, and to throw on when traveling. It's oversized so definitely size down. Very comfy and stylish.
Comfy and cute, great lightweight sweatshirt!
This sweatshirt was perfect for a late summer camping trip. It was super soft and warm.

links_reviews_title: I wanted to love this but the fit was weird and genuinely felt old (not in a good way)
links_reviews_text: Kind of boxy, felt old like thrifted, not high end vintage feel. Colors are nautical and cute
This sweater has a very comfy house fee to it. We on vacation to the mountains and I wore this every night snuggled by the fire and relaxing Will definitely be renting again
Loose fitting but super comfy and cute!!
I love everything about this sweatshirt. I may have to make this mine forever
This sweatshirt was great, perfect for casual day or evening. It has a loose fit but is slightly cropped. Great for traveling!

links_reviews_title: I wore this almost everyday. Got so many compliments. It is so cozy too.
links_reviews_text: everyday cozy soft

This fit exactly how I hoped it would. Slightly oversized, a bit boxy and cropped and slouch and luxurious. For a sweatshirt, it doesn't get much better. I rented this for everyday wear and for cool nights on an early summer trip to the hamptons. It was cute and cozy!
I could have a closet full of this comfy sweater that's cute and easy.

links_reviews_title: I love this sweater - it's really cute and comfy and the blue sherpa adds a fun twist!
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable, fits a little baggy so the size was perfect for me.

I wore this on a rainy spring day and to a baseball game. It was a little big, but I didn't mind because it made it feel so comfy cozy. It's thinner than it looks and will be perfect for those cool beach nights this summer!
nice fit. baggy fit with boyfriend jeans and sneaks looks great.
Loved this top. Would rent again.
It was cute for everyday wear. Didn't wear is very often just because the weather changed to be a bit warmer.
A great comfy sweatshirt that's meant to be oversized. I wore it several times and loved it!

Got the size they recommended and I expected a baggy sweater, but the width of the sweater is what threw me off. Incredibly wide and boxy, not even that long, so it kind of just floated around me and made me look larger. Love the materials and the colors, but I would maybe size down if you want something a little less wide.

links_reviews_title: Wore the on plane, so comfortable!
links_reviews_text: So comfortable and cute. Wore it a lot while traveling, loved this sweatshirt
Comfortable oversized sweatshirt
Nice, easy sweater to throw on for a comfy weekend running errands and hanging out at home.
This is a lose fit sweatshirt. Very warm and comfortable. I wore it a few times over the weekend and loved it.

links_reviews_title: So cute and comfortable, wore it several times over a weekend.
links_reviews_text: Oversized fit, but falls in a stylish and flattering way. Would definitely rent again.
High quality hoodie. Rent if you like OC.

I'm long waisted w monkey arms and this was cute but rode up in waist and arms. But that's my weird body. Size up if you have those issues like me :) Otherwise it was cool. The hood collar area stood up in a cool stylish way. Not floppy like a regular hoody. Has structure.

links_reviews_title: Only thing from RTR unltd I've worn 3x
links_reviews_text: Obsessed with this sweatshirt. Wore it for like 3 days straight. I ordered an XL hoping it would be tunic length but not so much. I'm 6' and next time will order an L or maybe even an M. The sleeves were def long enough with the XL. Layered it with a duster and it was warm enough for errands in December.
Got lots of compliments from the cool kids at work lol
...this sweatshirt was terrible
My girls loved wearing this designer sweatshirt on our recent ski vacation. One of the best things about RTR Unlimited is getting to wear a $400 sweatshirt!
Was hoping for a soft comfy sweaty even gonna size up. It ran small and the material was thin and stiff.
Nice thick fabric, felt substantial. Hood stands up in a cute way. Got lots of compliments at the office!
Spent the day running around the cherry blossom festival - comfy, relaxed, but still cool.
Very structured hoodie - not the coziest in the world but quite stylish
Comfy and cool print - dislike the mismatched hood strings (one has a gold cap and the other is clear plastic)

links_reviews_title: Cute pink, fitting my head through it was kind of tight.
links_reviews_text: Warm - comfy

links_reviews_title: Loved it! Made me feel one step up when running around doing errands or going to the gym.
links_reviews_text: Cozy but looks super cute on.
I love this sweatshirt! it is a lot less oversized than expected, but I didn't mind since I am small and oversized clothes tend to make me look like I am wearing a bag.

I ordered a size medium expecting it to be a little oversized, but it fit me perfectly so I was a little disappointed because I ordered it specifically to fit loosely. But, it is super cute and I would definitely order again just in a different size.
So comfy and chic! Loved this! Might buy!
Don't pick this if you are going for comfort. It runs small and short and the material is pretty stiff.

I loved this hoodie - I was really close to buying it... It's cute, comfortable and warm. It's also not a "sloppy" hoodie; in fact, I wore it to the office and didn't feel out of place. Highly recommend.
Love this sweater. Exactly what I expected, very cozy. Just the right "oversize".
Love this baby pink Opening Ceremony hoodie. Easily dresses up with jeans & kitten heels or can wear with leggings for running errands....

links_reviews_title: Flattering pink for any skin color
links_reviews_text: Great throw on hoody w/ feminine appeal so you don't feel so sloppy. Wish it was a bit more softer for a cozier wear but maybe purposely made to hold shape and structure.
Fit well. I loved this for running errands and hanging out around the house. Easy to throw on and elevates a lounging outfit.
Love the fitting and color
Ran small - size up

links_reviews_title: Super sporty chic for my trip to Disney World.
links_reviews_text: Fits a little oversized but in the right places. Fitted in the waist and arm bands.
Very warm, cute sweatshirt with gold accenting. Order size up so that it's more of a baggy sweatshirt feel with room to layer underneath.
Great quality - this sweatshirt is great in person and good for casual outfits!

I wore this oversized hoodie with black jeans and black booties. I really liked it, plus got compliments at work and from my man friend. Wore this only once, since it stretched out over the course of the day.

links_reviews_title: Okay sweater, the cream color has sparkle
links_reviews_text: This sweater was a good rotation for a winter work day. The sleeves have a fun shape but I didn't love the sparkle (not my style). Material wasn't too heavy.
Simple yet kind of elegant for a sweater. Maybe slight shimmer to it, but enjoyed the sleeves and colors. Felt Feminine in this.

links_reviews_title: Love the color block on the sleeves!
links_reviews_text: This sweater isn't quite as long as I'd hoped, but it's got a bit of sparkle at the wrists in the color block area and I love that touch! It's a great sweater for fall. Follow @raemrivera for more RTR reviews and affordable outfit inspo!

links_reviews_title: Comfortable sweater, with just enough detail to make it feel special
links_reviews_text: This is not a tight sweater, so the small still felt comfortable and roomy. The gold detailing at the neck and cuffs was nice

This was a cute sweater and I received a lot of compliments, however, it was really short. I felt like I was pulling it down all day. the sleeves were super cute; fitted and the wrist and then looser from the forearm up. The gold portion of the sweater is very metallic looking. This is the first time I've ordered anything from this designer and I'd be willing to try something else. Overall, a good rental.
This sweater was perfect for a late fall football game. It was comfy and had a little style. The gold part is more metallic than expected, but I liked it. Weather was in the upper 60s.

links_reviews_title: How good I felt in it
links_reviews_text: So warm and flattering. Great colors. I really considered purchasing

links_reviews_title: Crop length that just wasnt right

links_reviews_text: I love this sweater! I got so many compliments. However, only 4 stars because it's kinda short.

links_reviews_title: Casual comfortable with a lot of compliments
links_reviews_text: Reserved this as an everyday casual sweater and it was perfect! It fit great and was comfortable all day- no itching at all. I received several random compliments on it throughout the day which is always nice to hear! Would definitely rent this again.
Very nice sweater. Warm but not heavy. Nice length, not too shirt or long. Really liked it - will rent again.
Comfortable with unique cut on the sleeves. Liked the color contrast on the neckline and sleeves. Don't need to grab this again, but cute and warm for winter office styling!
The colors are beautiful in person and overall fit is very flattering.

Loved this sweater. The gold stripe on the sleeves and around the neck made it look a little fancier. Very comfortable, but it does run a little large. I sized down and it was pretty comfortable- I still had a little extra room in it.
Great sweater. More of a sweatshirt material with cute detail.

The sleeves are a cool feature and overall it's comfortable but the body of the sweater makes you seem a little shapless. Also there are gold flecks of fabric in the collar and the sleeves which you can't tell from the pics. Felt a little too christmasy.
Cute
Packed this sweater and wore straight out of the suitcase. Shimmery gold is subtle enough for day, but makes a dressier sweater transition for dinner out. Mid-weight and super comfy.
So so cute !!! Fit so well on my body. Post baby body and it was forgiving. Very flattering for my figure. Love the details
Loved the fit and color. Took one star away because it had small stain on shoulder.

I got a lot of compliments on this sweater. It was very comfy and the sleeve detail was a nice touch to add something to a simple sweater. I did wish it was a little bit longer, but I have a tall torso.

Love, love, love this sweater. The fit is PERFECT and classes up any silhouette - I wore it with ripped jeans for a casual look and with black cigarette pants for work. The pink and tan detailing is shimmery and adds the perfect extra element to the very versatile light grey. It's also a really great thickness - not too warm for indoors, but warm enough for the cold outside. Seriously considering buying this one!
short fitting

links_reviews_title: Comfortable and stylish. Would rent again
links_reviews_text: A little on the short side, but not enough to make it an issue

links_reviews_title: Casual with a bit of flair
links_reviews_text: Comfortable and fit great. There is a bit of shimmer that added some pizazz but wasn't over the top.

links_reviews_title: Super comfy and fun with the sparkley sleeve
links_reviews_text: Comfy and versitile

This top has gold glitter in the fabric at the neck and in the stripe between the pink sleeve and the grey body. I didn't look closely enough at the pic to realize it was glittery, so wanted to warn other customers! I didn't like the glitter, so I sent it back without wearing it. I gave it three stars b/c although I didn't like the way it looked, it was soft and the shape is cute.
a cozy sweater. will go a size down next time. it was a bit too big.

links_reviews_title: great sweater with jeans - easy to wear!
links_reviews_text: easy to wear with jeans or dressed up. comfortable! great colors for spring
Really liked this sweater. It has a great fit and wasn't too hot.

links_reviews_title: loved it. compliments at the office.
links_reviews_text: was a nice loose work sweater.
This was a warm cozy sweater that laid very well on me. Perfect for a relaxed get together with just a bit of flare.

Loved this casual sweater, which has a bit of sparkle to it (not sure I had expected that). I wore it at least three times and always got compliments. Very flattering sleeves and nice color palate. Unique.

links_reviews_title: The color combo was great. Got tons of compliments.
links_reviews_text: Great fit
Sits at waist but not too short
Very cute and cozy sweater
Loved the glittery pattern and the slightly poofed sleeves. Adds a little zest to winter wear!
Basic sweater with a bit of color detail
Not for long torso'd gals. Very beautiful, but way too short for me.

Wasn't too obsessed with this when I first put the outfit together but got a few compliments. The seam across the shoulder is not stretchy so could be a tough fit on some people and when you raise your arms it kinda pops up. Otherwise cute enough for a day at work

The shirt is super cute but bc of the ruffles at the top and it cutting off at my shoulders, any time I moved my arms higher than 45 degrees, the ruffles would bunch together and it didn't look great. If you can restrict yourself to minimal movement, it's a pretty cute shirt.
This top is great! Wore it to work with high waisted trousers then again that night with some denim shorts & a leather jacket. A tiny tiny bit see through

links_reviews_title: Did not wear it, because it made me feel quite restricted.
links_reviews_text: Fits very odd -- the ruched part is supposed to sit across your shoulders, but that makes it quite odd if you want to raise your arms, which I regularly do.

links_reviews_title: Cute blouse, but not a fan of the dropped shoulder feel.
links_reviews_text: Wasn't a fan of how the sleeves are dropped shoulder, didn't like the feel of the seam. Also the hook on the back was difficult to close. Didn't wear. Returned it.
Cute top, can be worn casual or slightly more put together. I did not end up wearing it, but the fit was good when I tried it on.
Nice blouse but too conservative for me. Frills on the neck was not my favorite look once I put it on. Lose fit.
pretty
Does not fit well in the bust, was too tight Also is very short so was barely at my waist not a great fit for Work
The yoke over the shoulders is ridiculously uncomfortable. If you raise your arms at all, the yoke goes up. Didn't wear it.
The back was a bit hard to clip together otherwise I loved this top. Light fabric and breathable

links_reviews_title: Cute and nice touch to my outfit
links_reviews_text: I decided to wear it unbuttoned with a crop top underneath for an outdoor concert. At 104 F , this garment was light and airy and added a nice touch to my all-in-Black outfit. I loved the red fabric inside the sleeves and the pattern didn't feel Too busy at all, but added a nice texture to the whole outfit. It was a fun piece.

links_reviews_title: Simple shirt with a lil extra something
links_reviews_text: Rented this to bring along on my honeymoon in Croatia and mostly wore it out to dinner with black jeans. I got it in store and didn't realize I got a medium but the relaxed/boxy fit made it fit fine. If I rented again, I'd probably try the L though! I preferred wearing it with my chest binder (I'm a 38 DDD and often wear my binder with button shirts) Only picture I got in it was in the dressing room when I tried it on! A pretty simple shirt, but the red inside the sleeves really did it for me.
The top grew on me as I wore it to work then a date. Not form fitting at all, but I loved the hint of red.
Love this blouse so much. Great material, lovely red lining which adds flare!! I received so many compliments throughout the night. Highly recommend this piece!

Wore this for a date night, and just felt OK in it. Fit was good and true to size and I thought the red accents would be more of a draw, but they were barely noticeable. Felt a little like a comfy PJ top.

links_reviews_title: Runs a tad large. Feels more casual
links_reviews_text: You can size down in this. The red under the sleeves adds a subtle flair - obviously red shoes or something would be a nice match. Felt more casual - very light good for a hot day to breathe.
Cute with everything...even sweatpants!
The red sleeves turn this otherwise chill shirt into a tacky Mess. Very comfy but I couldn't wear it out
Didn't really feel as if this piece was comfortable. I did receive compliments on it though. The material was a bit thin
Cute top with subtle details - I'd wear it more in the fall than summer. But easy to throw on with jeans and elevate your look.

links_reviews_title: Easy everyday piece with a touch of glam!
links_reviews_text: I loved this top. I wanted to purchase but didn't. Probably rent again and again. This top was fun and the peek-a-boo red along the inside of the sleeve cuff was gorgeous. It gave it the instant touch to not be basic. Being a button up collar blouse and in black I did have to punch it up. I wore it with jeans, strappy black heels, big wooden round earrings and rouge lipstick. My friend couldn't stop keeping their hands off the blouse. I wore this during the month of July in LA and i can say i felt cool in it, meaning not sweaty and stuffy. These type of tops can make me look top heavy so I option for a silky bralette or no padding bra.
Not quite as stylish I had hoped, but the material is nice.

links_reviews_title: This is a nice everyday piece.
links_reviews_text: Love the red detail
This top is fine. I kinda felt like Count Dracula with the black and red lining. Won't rent again.

links_reviews_title: Received many compliments, went well with my midi black skirt and red shoes.
links_reviews_text: Comfortable, attractive

links_reviews_title: unique addition for all black outfit
links_reviews_text: really fun top for an otherwise boring all-black outfit. I think the way to make this work is with high-waisted pants, otherwise the shirt is a bit cropped. The zebra print wasn't too obvious.
Cool easy top to wear with jeans. There is a hint of red inside the sleeves that is fun too.
Great top however it kinda looks like a pajama top so you need to pair it with something and tuck it in

links_reviews_title: great top. love the red on the underside of the sleeves
links_reviews_text: true to size and loved the zebra print.

links_reviews_title: Boxy top didn't work with any of my bottoms.
links_reviews_text: Buttons came all broken (small pieces of each button were slivered off). The quality, print, and fabric all were cute. The shape didn't work for me. Very boxy and shorter in length (I have a long torso). Too short to French tuck.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful button down with a flair
links_reviews_text: This is a great everyday button down blouse that has a little something special to it without being over the top. The black printed design and red interior of the sleeves make this fun and interesting, but still versatile enough to dress up, dress down, wear to work, wear out, etc.
Fit wasn't flattering on my body type and fabric was not what I expected

links_reviews_title: One that you think will work, but ends up being eh
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to love this top - it’s a modern kimono! Alas, it wasn’t meant to be. The medium was a little too short, the large was still workable, but I felt sloppy in it. The material doesn’t feel luxe and is warm. Even without a jacket, a little heat and I felt like I became a humid tent in it. Not a fan.
This piece does have a bit of sexy silk pajama feel to it, but it's a fun piece with a nice oversized billowy fit and fun print

This top is so versatile, fun and unique. I wore it to work, to a concert, and out with friends. On cold days, I wore a black long sleeved t underneath and layered it with a red button down. I got a lot of compliments.
a little loose

links_reviews_title: Cute top with a peek of red
links_reviews_text: Loved this shirt, but don't have an occasion to wear it while I rented. Would be great for a date night, girls night out or party.
There's an animal print I didn't notice online. I didn't wear this top

This shirt felt like I was wearing a pajama shirt it was so comfy - however, it was way more boxy than I intended. I thought with the angled cut it would be more flattering, but the medium just hung very unshapely on me. I wore it once and did a partial tuck to give it some more definition, but it was overall just a meh top for me.
It is a baggy and boxy top but it is also short so does not overwhelm a shorter girl like myself. red silk in the sleeves is a trendy and beautiful touch. I will definitely rent again.
It's so chic! It's oversized but fits at the neck. I love the pop of red at the sleeve. I got tons of compliments and was super comfortable.

This is such a comfortable top!! It's a bit short in the torso which was perfect for me as most blouses are too long and go way past my hips. The details and splash of red are subtle and make for a great casual Friday without being dull!
Wore this for work, it was a hit and everyone commented on it. The silk is soft and breaths well and the red detail and sleeve makes the top. I loved this blouse!
Not flattering on my broad shoulders.

links_reviews_title: Cute oversized blazer, but is sparkly
links_reviews_text: Really liked the fit of this blazer, but wasn't a huge fan of how shiny and sparkly the fabric was.

Was never a fan of blazers but recently wanted to give them another try and was very happy with this one. Fit exactly like I always wants them too- loose and oversized for that stylish borrowed from the boys look but still flattering for my figure. I didn't like the pockets in the hips as I think they added some unnecessary material but otherwise great rental.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful sparkly leopard print! Purposely oversized fit.
links_reviews_text: Loved the style and print of this blazer. The fabric is woven with gold shimmery thread that is very elegant - super easy to dress up or down. It's oversized but it's meant to be that way (for a French je ne sais quoi, you know?). The construction was maybe a bit too soft. Like when I put my phone in the pocket, the pocket would sag. That made it look less SHARP than I wanted. In any case, it was very comfortable and fun for work. I wear a 4-6 and I wore the 1/Small and it was plenty roomy.
It was a great jacket, more formal that I expected and it is a bit shiny. I got a lot of compliments but wouldn't wear to work again... more for a dressier occasion
Liked the fit - oversized and good w fitted jeans
Super cute blazer!! Love wearing it and have rented it twice now :) fits great super easy from day to night
awesome work to night out blazer !! very trendy & adds a stylish touch to an everyday outfit. loose fit & boxy, which I find great for layering. love it!
I wore this to a costume party and it was great. The shoulders are padded and the fit is a little boxy.

Great blazer and easy way to try the animal print trend - this runs true to size, I usually wear a 4/6. Note that there is not much stretch at all so if you have broad shoulders are a more muscular build, a size up would be more comfortable.

Only thing to improve this blazer would be real pockets. It does have one inside pocket, and was a little shinier than I was expecting, but still perfect for work and an after-work thing. Felt very put together all day.
This coat was fab. Would rent again. Looked great with a tee or a formal cami. Runs slightly large but I liked the loose fit.
Loved this edgy look. I took off one star because some of the metallic threads would come through the arm lining and poke me occasionally. But overall I'm glad I rented it!

I would like live in this blazer! It was so fun; I wore it to work and received so many compliments from colleagues and clients. It does run big; but I didn't even care. I felt like an absolute boss babe.
I am obsessed!!!!! This is the best casual Friday look ever I love this blazer. It's a little big but the oversized look is in!
Beautiful jacket with a brilliant shine to the texture. I loved the comfortable fit. Nice pockets as well.
Cute blazer - would definitely recommend. Sleeve length was perfect. Blazer didn't look great buttoned; it made me look lumpy. I wore it open and liked the way it looked. Great length, also!

Love this piece and wore it a bunch of times. It's great tucked into jeans or over a black dress. Little bit of edge for a conventional blazer. Definitely runs big. I got the 2 after reading reviews and returned it for the 1.

I rented this blazer for work. Unfortunately for me and fortunately for many others this comes with a metallic sheen! Not ideal for an office setting but beautiful for a party. Jacket itself is WONDERFUL
Very boxy and unflattering. Didn't love the shine.
Size down!!

Went with Size 2 based on the reco, but I was swimming in it. It's a great material but the over-sized, boxy cut did nothing for me. I felt like I was wearing my Grandpa's suit jacket, fit-wise... but the material/leopard print is great. Overall, I tried but couldn't pull this off.
Beautiful jacket- I wish it had fit. I will size down next time
Cute blazer, be aware it has gold shiny thread woven into it
Rented this for work, size runs very large but fabric and cut was nice
Ultimately, I think leopard is a little over but I wore with all black and messy hair to a dinner party and looked a bit like an off duty middle aged rockstar. So, generally good.

links_reviews_title: a little too much for me
links_reviews_text: The design - leopard print with metallic accents - ended up being a little too much for me, and I did not end up wearing this. My husband said it would look great for an Elton John costume party! I think a more adventurous dresser would LOVE this, but while I thought it would be a good accent piece over all black, it ended up being a little too loud. The fit is a bit oversized, which on a really thin woman would probably work well, but for a curvier girl like me - felt a little boxy and made me look bigger.
Perfect for the girl who wears too much black! Throw this over anythinggggff

i really loved the fabric and pattern of this blazer. however, this fit was too boxy/large for my personal taste and style. i could totally see someone else pull this off with some cute skinny jeans. give it a try.
I liked the fabric on this but the sizing was off for me.
I didn't love this. It is sparkly in real life and the cut is more boxy than it appeared in the photo.

links_reviews_title: Way too big. Sizing way off!
links_reviews_text: I thought this would be a fun blazer to wear to work. It is very boxy and very large. I have petite shoulders, but was majorly swimming in it. It was more sparkly than I expected, but that wasn't a big deal. This sizing was way off!
Very large

I'm so disappointed by this blazer because it is so sparkly. It fits perfectly (I'm normally a 6 and the 1 fits me TTS) but it's so sparkly it almost looks like a costume. I rented this for work and there's no way I could wear this in a professional setting. Other reviews mentioned a little sparkle but I had no idea how much. I wish I had a fun party or event to wear this to, but sadly I'll be returning without wearing.
It was very boxy and not super flattering

links_reviews_title: Loved the compliments I got for wearing this.
links_reviews_text: It is funky but a little big and boxy.

links_reviews_title: Love the fit. Great with slacks or skirt. Nice causal fabric.
links_reviews_text: I'd rent it again for everyday. Fun fabric.

links_reviews_title: This is just okay. I wore it once. Perhaps just too aggressive for my style.
links_reviews_text: oversize fit but tailored
Really cool and exactly what it looks like on the site, but ultimately was a little too trendy for me.

links_reviews_title: great fit, super comfy and very expensive looking
links_reviews_text: wore this one a few times..the shoulder pads made it very boxy but otherwise the fit was perfect. very soft and comfy. would definitely wear again.
The jacket looked more matte and fitted. Expected material to be thick. Moreso thin and very large! Didn't wear

links_reviews_title: Cute, fun &(obviously) entirely see through..butttt no pockets! Cute not not entirely practical

links_reviews_text: Great colors and my husband said I was easy to spot at the fair. Something different for me and my RTR closet. Runs large and liked the colors.
Super thin--great for warm rainy days
Such a cute jacket! It's definitely not warm or water-resistant, but good for a cool look.

links_reviews_title: So fashionable and lightweight. Perfect for summer showers.
links_reviews_text: Loved it.

links_reviews_title: Nice for a casual day with a light breeze.
links_reviews_text: Cute, fun, feminine colors, but still sporty and not "too girly". This jacket is definitely just for a fun pop of color and not to keep you warm, dry or protect you from wind. It's incredibly thin, but the material feels really nice.
Lovely, light fabric with great details like the pastel color blocking and type on the back. I'm 5'2", 135lbs and this didn't overwhelm my frame.
Colors are cute! It is a bit baggy and I didn't end of wearing it but very light and great for traveling!

links_reviews_title: I wore this on a trip to Philadelphia.
links_reviews_text: The jacket is extremely cute and I got compliments on it. It's surprisingly warm for being an unlined windbreaker. There are ties you can cinch on the waist which were annoying because they were long and in the way. Also, the zipper was messed up and wouldn't zip down all the way which was annoying. Overall though, this jacket was really cute.
I rented this for weekend sports event. Was very cute very lightweight so won't keep you warm but helps if it's raining.

I loved this sweater. Loved the shape and color (though you will expose tummy if you raise your arms). Long arms with black on the under side for interest. Didn't love the fabric, it's pretty scratchy/cheap feeling.

links_reviews_title: Solid sweater but a little itchy
links_reviews_text: The sweater overall is pretty good but it runs pretty large and is very shapeless even tucked in. I did get a lot of compliments on it at work but by the end of the day it was a little too itchy for it's price point. Definitely size down and maybe wear a tank top under it to prevent the itch.

links_reviews_title: great fit and warm for a chilly Chicago day
links_reviews_text: Great fit and warm for a chilly Chicago day

I’ve had this sweater on my list for such a long time and never managed to get it until now and it did not disappoint! I love the red color and the contrasting black on the bottom of the sleeve is a super cool accent - the knit of the black is also tighter than the red and it’s just a great detail. It isn’t the softest but the weight is nice for a big sweater as it is cozy but not too thick. Definitely oversized and boxy, but the shorter length makes it sexy. High funnel neck to keep you even cozier. Will keep it for a while.
Loved the color but the cut didn't look good on me.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable sweater with a bit of personality
links_reviews_text: I liked the bigger/boxier fit of this. It still feels tailored and has some fun black pattern under that makes this a bit more stylish than just an everyday winter sweater. Very comfortable and warm.
Incredibly warm and perfect cut. Has a 'fancy' look to it just because of the quality of the piece, even though it is a simple sweater.

The sweater has an oversized look to it. The black on the sleeves make it unique. The sleeves are a little long, but I think they are supposed to fit that way. It keep me so warm without a coat in an ice skating rink, so I was very pleased with the quality of it. LOVE IT!

I rented this lovely burgundy sweater for a family Thanksgiving trip and got SO many compliments (and even a few people asking to borrow it!!) Fit: Oversized, but flattering. I loved it because it was super comfortable but looked very on-trend. The sleeves to have a baggy look around the chest/armpits, especially when seated (see photo). Pros: Color was AMAZING. I loved the way the color photographed, especially outdoors. I didn't find the material itchy at all. Cons: None! It was perfect :)

This is probably the most shapeless thing you will ever put on. I took it out of the bag and couldn't believe it. I was going to return it immediately but it ended up being freezing out, and I needed something warm. I actually didn't hate it when I wore it. I wish I had sized down. I will not rent it again.

Really loved this sweater. It was a deep maroon color and that kept me warm in the winter months. The sleeves were a bit long but I didn't really see that as a negative. Overall great top for a a casual event.

Great sweater with jeans and boots. The high neck is great and doesn't fold over. It has a very unconstructed fit and is a bit short if you are on the taller side. I loved it and wore it several different times on cold winter days!
Runs pretty big.

It wasn't "wow worthy", but it was cozy and warm for Iowa winter. I'm 5'8", 150 pounds and wore a Medium. I probably could have gone with a small, but the medium gave it a slightly over sized, cozy feel.

This sweater is trendy, versatile, and warm. In one week I was able to wear it to work, dinner with friends, and a family event. It makes an outfit look pulled together while being super comfortable at the same time.

links_reviews_title: Great fit and goes with everything
links_reviews_text: Great everyday sweater! Fits perfectly oversized and was extremely comfortable. Can dress up or down - I wore to work and got so many compliments on it!
Intended to be oversized but chic enough that it doesn't look frumpy. I was worried about the neck being itchy, but it wasn't at all!

links_reviews_title: I love this sweater, so comfy and the cut is super sweet
links_reviews_text: It's roomy and comfy, such a good match with slim jeans and heels
great boxy fit, perfect length on my 5'10" body
Great sweater, perfect for easy weekend brunch plans. Torso a little shorter than I thought but still long enough to cover
Cool sleeves but way to itchy for me to enjoy also super short in front so have to wear high rise bottoms
Sweater was more oversized than I expected but loved the color. Perfect for every day

links_reviews_title: Wore this as a casual weekend piece
links_reviews_text: cute but very oversized sweater
Arms are a bit long but I'm on the shorter side
TTS, navy detailing on the sleeves.

links_reviews_title: Great work sweater for more casual work environments
links_reviews_text: I got tons of compliments on this ("you always have the best sweaters"). It is baggy and "shapeless" but that's the whole point of the look- pairs well with skinny jeans or leggings and is super cozy. It is slightly itchy but I always wear a thin shirt under sweaters so that didn't bother me much. I almost kept it!

Overall, I like this sweater. I think it's a little big for smaller frames, but it is very warm and cozy. I did have to wear a long-sleeve t-shirt underneath because it is itchy, but that works well when it's cold outside. Cute tucked into jeans. Can be worn dressed up or dressed down.
Looks great with a dark black, slim jean. Perfect for work. It doesn't look as warm as one may think, so if you're going out somewhere cold, layer up. Loved it, super comfy.

links_reviews_title: Cozy and stylish but a bit scratchy
links_reviews_text: It's big and boxy in a deliberate way, but cropped so if you wear with high waitlisted jeans it is still flattering. Needed a t-short underneath to keep it off my chest otherwise it was too itchy. The black under arms is unexpected and cool.
Loved the extra long sleeves, it is an interesting accent. Great everyday sweater, soft feel and great fit! It was a little high for my neck. A little short on the body.
Very warm, runs large but easy to wear

links_reviews_title: Not great on a small frame
links_reviews_text: This is a nice deep burgundy and black knit, with very large dolman sleeves with black panels. The fit is pretty boxy, and was not particularly flattering on my 5'2" 119-lb frame.

Loved this sweater for an everyday casual look. I wore it to work one day and out for lunch another day — it was warm & had a cool, slouchy look to it which garnered a few compliments. Recommend you order your true size, as the M (only size available) was a bit big.
I love the look of this sweater but it runs super oversized and is VERY itchy. I found myself taking it off halfway through my day because I couldn't get over the itch.
